Innovation. Transformation. Glass Packaging.

Glass is a material unlike any other, capable of creating stunning, memorable experiences, and it’s the most sustainable packaging material on earth. At O-I, we have a history of transforming how the world stores food and beverages – of making glass more accessible to more customers and consumers. We reimagine how glass is made and sold by innovating production techniques, pioneering recycling and sustainable technology, and unleashing the iconic, brand-building potential of this packaging that is the kindest material for the planet and its people.

Read Our Story
News and Stories
Advancing Glass Recycling Through Groundbreaking Programs and Partnerships in 2024
DECEMBER 18, 2024
Kentucky Glass Recycling Gets a Green Boost: Ale-8-One and O-I Lead the Charge
DECEMBER 10, 2024
In Quest to Produce the Most Sustainable Bottled Water, Beika Turns to O-I for Packaging
DECEMBER 3, 2024
Design Book 3: Creative Reality - Innovative Solutions to Packaging Concepts
OCTOBER 3, 2024
OUR VISION
Shaping the Future Through Glass

We create iconic, healthy glass packaging so synonymous with brands, you recognize those brands by their packaging alone, even without a label. We innovate packaging design to enable customers to meet their own ambitions, from connecting with consumers on an emotional level to creating a more sustainable future.

OUR STORY
Driven Through Innovation

Innovation and transformation are in our DNA. O-I Glass was founded more than a century ago by a man whose glass bottle making machine was called the most significant invention in glass in 2000 years. Founder Michael J. Owens’ motto was “It can be done.” And we’re doing it. We’re reimaging what glass can do, making it the world’s most versatile, charismatic and sustainable packaging material.

OUR MISSION
Our Sustainability Vision

Glass is the ideal packaging material to support a low-waste, circular economy. But sustainability isn’t just about what we make – it’s also about how we make it. Sustainability is woven into everything we do, from transforming our glass-making technology and processes to our customer approach to how we engage our employees and support our communities.

1
2
3
Power of
Glass Packaging

Glass is pure, sustainable, and the kindest packaging material for the health of people and the planet. Glass has an element of magic to it. It is beautiful and iconic. It can turn into shapes. It plays with the senses. Glass is 100% recyclable and infinitely recyclable. It does not increase ocean pollution. Glass is virtually inert, which means it doesn’t interact with the foods and beverages it holds.

We love glass and we aspire to create a healthier, more sustainable, and more exciting world through glass packaging.

Discover Benefits of Glass
Guided by Our Values

At O-I, we deeply care about our people and our culture. Guided by our values and behaviors, we’re constantly seeking to transform how we support and engage employees and the communities in which we work and live.

See Our Careers
Stay Connected

One Shared Vision

To help people improve their lives by providing products and services they value more highly than their alternatives, and do so responsibly while consuming fewer resources. Guardian and its family of companies employ over 11,800 people that live and work in 25 countries across five continents

ABOUT US

Careers: Opportunities to grow

SUPPLIER PORTAL
 
Our Companies

Whether working with small shops or global partners, we bring effective solutions to our customers through our two businesses, Guardian Glass and SRG Global.

Guardian Glass

Guardian Glass is Guardian’s largest business and ​one of the world’s largest manufacturers of float, ​value-added and fabricated glass products and solutions. At its 24 float lines around the world, Guardian Glass produces high performance glass for architectural, residential, interior, transportation and technical glass applications. You’ll find our glass in homes, offices and cars and in some of the world’s most iconic projects.

Go to Guardian Glass
SRG Global

SRG Global® is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of integrated, functional decorative systems for the automotive, mobility, and commercial truck industries. SRG Global has a manufacturing presence in major world regions including North America, Western and Central Europe, and Asia.

Go to SRG Global
Latest News

News on company groundbreakings, product launches, stunning architectural projects, leadership announcements and more.

Atlas Holdings signs agreement to acquire SRG Global

Atlas Holdings and Guardian Industries have signed an agreement for an affiliate of Atlas Holdings to acquire SRG Global, one of the world’s leading manufacturers of integrated and functional decorative trim systems for the automotive, mobility, and commercial truck industries. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed. The transaction is anticipated to close by early 2025, subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approval.

Read more
Guardian Glass signs agreement to acquire Vortex Glass

The transaction allows Guardian Glass to expand its make-to-order fabrication business to supply key customers in Florida and the Caribbean with hurricane laminated and insulated glass.

Everyone at Corelle Brands is focused on one purpose: to make togetherness easier. Every day. In every home. We’re home to an iconic family of brands – Corelle®, Corningware®, Pyrex®, Snapware®, Chicago Cutlery® and Visions® – who are already known for creating ingenious products to prepare and serve food. Soon we’ll be introducing ingenious solutions to help us all enjoy being together, everywhere in the home.

Intentional innovation

Everything we make at Corelle Brands starts with the consumer: who they are, what they need, how they live together. As their lives evolve, so do our products, keeping step and always looking to delight.

Open
worldview

To make products for the world, we employ the world. It is in diversity that we find our strength. Our inclusive workforce brings together people with a wide range of backgrounds, perspectives, opinions and skills – all focused on making togetherness easier for all

Integrity everywhere

We always choose the right path over the easy path, even when nobody is watching. That philosophy permeates our entire process, from the quality choices we make in manufacturing all the way to how we treat our consumers.

Our Services
Windows and Doors

Modernize and update your home with high-quality windows and doors that combine style, energy efficiency, and durability. Whether you’re enhancing your curb appeal, improving your home’s comfort, or increasing its value, Great Day Improvement’s selection of custom solutions is designed to meet your unique needs. From replacement windows to entry doors, we offer expert installation and exceptional customer service to ensure that your project exceeds expectations. Trust us to make your home brighter, more secure, and energy-efficient for years to come.

Gutters, Siding & Roofing

At Great Day Improvements, we specialize in enhancing the exterior of your home with top-quality siding, gutters, and roofing solutions designed to boost both curb appeal and protection. Whether you’re looking to upgrade your home’s aesthetic, improve energy efficiency, or safeguard against the elements, our expert team offers custom services tailored to meet your needs. With a commitment to exceptional craftsmanship and reliable, durable products, we ensure your home stands strong and looks great for years to come.

Additions and Enclosures

Enjoy your outdoor living space more with custom patio and pool enclosures that blend style, functionality, and durability. Whether you’re looking to extend your outdoor season, enhance privacy, or create a stunning focal point for relaxation and entertainment, our expertly designed enclosures offer the perfect solution. With a wide range of options tailored to your specific needs, Great Day Improvements ensures your patio or pool area is protected from the elements while maintaining an open, airy feel that allows you to enjoy your outdoor space year-round.

Bath and Kitchen

Transform your bathroom into a serene retreat with simple yet impactful upgrades that blend style and function. Whether you’re looking to refresh your space with modern fixtures, optimize storage, or create a spa-like atmosphere, there are countless ways to elevate your bathroom experience. Or, add functionality and a modern look to your kitchen without the time and expense of a full remodel with our kitchen makeovers. These improvements will not only enhance your daily routine but also increase the overall value and appeal of your home.

Friendlier products for a cleaner, safer world

PQ is a leading global provider of silicates, silicas and derivative products. PQ’s products are used in a wide variety of industrial processes and many customer products, from decorative paints to green cement, from clean drinking water to green tires and from toothpaste to biofuels and beer.

Our Products & Markets

PQ’s products are crucial ingredients in a diverse set of industrial and consumer applications. Our performance chemicals act as cleaning and whitening agents in toothpaste, create a “matted” finish on surface coatings and remove impurities from beer and edible oils. PQ has capabilities to provide silicates, silicas and derivate products in multiple forms. Our long legacy and market leadership is seen with brands like Gasil ® and Sorbosil ®

We are at the forefront of safety and sustainability

For over 200 years, PQ has envisioned the future of performance chemicals through collaborative innovation, making products that touch all of us, every day.

We are a leading global supplier of silicates, silicas and derivative products that serve as environmentally friendly substitutes for materials used in a variety of applications.

Building on a global footprint that spans across 13 countries, our talented and dedicated employees come from a diverse population with more than half of our 1,500 employees being located outside the United States.

See more

We firmly believe that success is achieved through the intellect and commitment of our people, so we employ a long-term human capital program to attract, retain, and develop talent for the future.

Working with us

Our corporate culture is built on five core values: Integrity, Safety, People, Customer Focus and Sustainability. Our business must comply with the laws of over 100 countries.

Our core values

Our rigorous Enterprise Risk Management (“ERM”) process enables our team to evaluate and address operational and compliance risks that we face in our businesses.

Ethics and governance

ANCHOR HOCKING GLASSWARE​

We began in 1905 with a simple goal: make the glass that homes really need. Anchor Hocking glassware showcases the genius of utility that stands the test of time. Our glass bakeware, drinkware, serveware, housewares, food storage items, mix & measure items, and pantry solutions are as relevant and trend-savvy today as they were more than a century ago. We just keep innovating for you as we reinforce the favorites that you’ve loved forever.

The ultimate solution for transporting and carrying your delicious homemade dishes – Our 3qt Bake Dish with Truelock Locking Lid™! This innovative product ensures secure and fresh food during transit, with the insulated tote keeping it hot or cold for hours. Perfect for potlucks, picnics, and family gatherings, it’s your go-to for serving food in style. No more spills or lukewarm dishes – transport your culinary creations with peace of mind and in impeccable style.

EXPLORE BAKEWARE

Starting your day off right is essential, and breakfast is the perfect opportunity. Luckily, the right kitchen utensils make preparing a delicious breakfast both easy and enjoyable. Whether you’re a busy mom, having brunch with friends, or a hostess who’s looking to wake up your special guests with a beautiful morning spread, find our top product picks to make prepping, cooking, and cleaning up, a walk in the park.

We’ve been making Anchor Hocking glassware right here in the USA for more than a century. For all that time, our products have remained a staple in kitchens around the world by staying on the edge of craftsmanship and in the center of American-made quality. 

Supporting American jobs is a source of great pride for us, and it’s important to our customers too. They appreciate our dedication to the workforce here at home. And abroad, “made in the USA” means something else – quality.

It’s simple. Utility can be smart and beautiful. Style can still have function. Innovative is also durable. From our family to yours, thank you for supporting us through the years. We look forward to serving you with Anchor Hocking glassware for many more years to come

Food
OUR INNOVATIVE EXPERTISE

Innovation isn't optional anymore when you’re in the business of creating things people eat: Companies know they must continually develop new products with creative flavors and healthy formulations in order to grab and hold market share. Fortunately, innovation is in our family company's DNA, and we combine that inventive nature with state-of-the-art facilities and unparalleled experience in bringing new products to market.

OUR CAPABILITIES

Our food capabilities explained in just six words: You need it, we got it! Yes, that’s a bit simplistic, a little boastful and not exactly eloquent, but it’s absolutely spot on. With five decades of experience, state-of-the-art facilities and seasoned professionals, LiDestri can provide a comprehensive range of food products and services that is one word: amazing.

We’re specialists in sauces, salsas, dips and can get up-to-speed for whatever you need. Across all of our lines we have specialists solely dedicated to producing and improving processing techniques and packaging for everything we produce.

OUR INNOVATION CENTER

For most consumer product R&D companies – whether working on a dip, sauce or salsa – manufacturing happens on two scales: small-batch and full-scale production. That approach is limited, since what works in a test kitchen may not translate to a scalable mass-market product.
The LiDestri Innovation Center is the answer to that problem.

Created in 2014, the Innovation Center provides our national brand and private label partners with the facilities, equipment, and expertise necessary to develop products from scratch in an environment that accurately simulates full-scale production. Our product development connoisseurs, certified tasters, process improvement experts, and packaging designers help our partners improve their existing products to craft and produce some amazing original offerings.

WHAT OUR CUSTOMERS SAY ABOUT INNOVATION AT LIDESTRI

In this testimonial from Newman’s Own President and CEO Mike McGrath, LiDestri’s decades-long consumer packaged goods (CPG) partner describes our contract manufacturing approach to innovation in the co-creation of Common Good Organic Pasta Sauce.

In this testimonial from Wegmans Food Markets CEO Danny Wegman, LiDestri’s decades-long retail brand partner describes our contract manufacturing approach to innovation in the co-creation of Organic Food You Feel Good About Jammin’ fruit spreads.

LEARN MORE ABOUT HOW WE INNOVATE
NEWS AND PRESS

Read all about it! As an industry leader with a reputation for breakthrough innovation, LiDestri is often positively featured in news coverage in both mainstream media and top trade publications. New product introductions, breakthrough processing technologies, packaging innovations, plus insights and opinions by LiDestri experts and executives often make news.





OUR INDUSTRY CERTIFICATIONS

At LiDestri we understand that increased governmental and consumer interest in food safety, regulatory compliance and product traceability are more important than ever. It’s important that our partners, suppliers and everyone who consumes our products know that we meet or exceed all certification requirements for each line of business.

A global supplier in sustainable packaging solutions

Ardagh​​ Group is a global supplier of sustainable, infinitely recyclable, metal and glass packaging for brand owners around the world. The consistent pursuit of market-leading innovation, quality and customer service, backed by investment in our people and processes, underpins everything we do.

We remain focused on continuous improvement in all aspects of our business to deliver long-term, sustainable success for our stakeholders.

Ardagh operates 60 metal and glass production facilities in 16 countries, employing approximately 20,000 people with sales of approximately $9.4bn.

Ardagh Metal Packaging (AMP), 76%-owned by Ardagh Group is listed on the New York Stock Exchange.

Ardagh Group also holds a 42% interest in Trivium Packaging, a leading supplier of sustainable metal packaging to the food & specialty and personal care markets.

Ardagh is pleased to announce that its acquisition of Consol Holdings Proprietary Limited, the leading
producer of glass packaging on the African continent, has completed.

Our business
$9.4bn global sales
60 production facilities
20,000 employees
Manufacturing in 16 countries
100% recyclable materials
Our Purpose and Core Values

The people at Ardagh share much more than a strong brand and an excellent reputation. We each share a common Purpose – We make packaging for good. Our Purpose defines who we are as a company and forms the foundation of our business. Our Purpose enables us to deliver customer innovation, provides an inspirational environment for our people and drive our business through growth and development.

The future we’re creating for Ardagh is built around our four Core Values of Inclusion, Trust, Teamwork and Excellence. We are committed to conducting our activities with the highest standards of integrity and business practice in dealing with all of our stakeholders. Our Code of Conduct is a guide for conducting our business in an honest and professional manner.

Benefits of metal packaging

Metal beverage packaging is universally recognised for its protective qualities, versatility and environmental credentials. Metal is a permanent material, meaning it can be infinitely recycled without any loss of quality. Metal beverage cans are one of the most recycled drinks package in the world, contributing to a circular economy.​

Metal can packaging offers versatility, unlimited design and brand building opportunities like no other material and is used across the world in many market sectors. Constantly evolving production technologies are used to ensure exciting possibilities and environmental sustainability in metal beverage packaging for the future.

Benefits of glass packaging

Glass packaging protects its content and enhances a brand’s appeal. As a permanent material glass is 100% and infinitely recyclable, making it the perfect packaging choice for products today and in the future. Ardagh produces distinctive and innovative glass packaging in all shapes and sizes for the world’s leading brands and offers a choice of almost 20 different colours.

Being infinitely recyclable, a glass bottle or jar can be made into a new one over and over again, with no loss in quality or purity. Making new glass bottles and jars from recycled glass reduces the amount of energy needed in the production process and lowers emissions into the atmosphere.

Gallo Glass, established in 1958, is a state-of-the-art highly-innovative glass manufacturer committed to meeting the needs of its customers while minimizing its impact on the environment.
Gallo Glass is the largest glass container plant in the United States and is dedicated to delivering service and quality to the wine & spirits industry.
Our Products

Gallo Glass offers a variety of wine and spirits design options ranging from Eco Flint to Premium bottles. We pride ourselves on personalized service. 

Glass — The Natural Alternative

Glass is made  from all-natural materials. It is the preferred packaging among customers who value it for maintaining the purity of the foods and beverages they consume.

ISO Standards of Excellence

Gallo Glass is committed to providing a safe and healthful workplace that manufactures quality products, according to food safety standards, in an environmentally responsible and energy efficient manner. We are ISO 14001 and 22000 certified. 

Over

Years of Innovation
0
1950s
When it All Began

When Ernest and Julio Gallo founded the Gallo Glass Company in 1958, they were launching a new era in bottle making. They had a vision for state-of-the-art glass manufacturing that would meet the needs of consumers while minimizing the impact on the environment.

1970s
Breaking Through the Turbulence

When many glassmaking factories were shutting their doors because of the energy crisis, Gallo glass was picking up steam. With the addition of two new furnaces, they we able to manufacture more bottles with five operating furnaces.

1980s
Thinking Smarter, Not Harder

With the rising environmental concerns over glass manufacturing, Gallo made its process more efficient and less wasteful. They invested in triple gob coolers and designed smaller bottles. They also switched from mechanical to computerized timing control.

1990s
Taking Oxy-Fuel Firing Full Steam

Many companies were researching effective methods for reducing NOx emissions, but Gallo Glass was a pioneer at making it possible on a larger scale by building their first cryogenic oxygen facility armed with electrostatic precipitator emissions control equipment.

2000s
A Clear Path for a New Era

The installation of modern equipment and processes gave a boost to the firing and manufacturing speed. With that Gallo was able to increase the overall quality, ISO and automation for bulk production while decreasing bottle weight.

2010s
Seeing a Sustainable Future

Throughout the decades, glassmaking has revolutionized for the sake of the environment and Gallo Glass is proud of what they’ve contributed. They continue their commitment to sustainability by maintaining state-of-the-art furnaces, modern manufacturing processes and control practices.

We are dedicated to upholding the highest environmental standards and leading the global glass industry with energy-efficient furnaces.
Gallo Glass was the first industrial application of oxy fuel technology in container glass, reducing NOx emissions by 80% or the equivalent to taking over 97,000 cars off the road.
We are on the forefront of innovation across the industry with advancements in lighter weight bottles, Eco Flint, clear glass flint reclamation, and so much more.

Sustainability
Sustainability at all levels

By 2030, Gerresheimer will only procure electricity from renewable energy sources and will reduce its CO2 emissions by 50% by 2030. We set ourselves these ambitious sustainability targets because we firmly believe that only companies that act responsibly and sustainably have a future.

Previous
Next
Excellence
Benchmark for quality

Quality comes first at Gerresheimer - as a daily philosophy and commitment to our customers. By using state-of-the-art technologies, we ensure that our products meet the highest hygiene and safety requirements and comply with the strictest legal regulations.

Previous
Next
Global footprint
Operating globally and close to customers

Gerresheimer develops and produces in 35 local plants in Europe, America and Asia. We know our customers' needs and the markets. This ensures that we find the right solutions more quickly and can guarantee sustainable and environmentally friendly production with high added value at the individual locations.

Previous
Next

Two strong companies are becoming one. Two success stories will have one future! The highly complementary portfolios of the two companies will allow us to offer you an even broader range of drug containment solutions.

Previous
Next
Purpose
A better life for millions of people

With our products we help to protect the health of millions of people and enable those affected to enjoy a better quality of life. "Innovating for a better life" is the motto according to which about 13,400 Gerresheimer employees on three continents develop and produce every day with a high level of industrial competence and impact.

Our new plant in Fishers (Indiana) USA

The new U.S. hub in Fishers is designed to support North American pharmaceutical customers.
The facility houses state-of-the-art production lines equipped with advanced process technologies to produce drug containment solutions and drug delivery devices, and an after-sales support center for equipment.

DISCOVER MORE 
PLATFORMS EZ-fill® Kit: Ready-to-use components for fast access to small volumes

All the advantages of the EZ-fill® platform in a high-quality compact packaging kit. A complete high-quality kit to meet your needs across the entire drug life cycle, from the clinical phase to small commercial batches. The perfect solution to protect, store, and deliver your drug product safely.

WHO WE ARE
WE’RE AN OEM GLASS SUPPLIER TO ALL MAJOR AUTO MANUFACTURERS

WHY WE'RE DIFFERENT

If you want replacement glass that matches the quality of your original manufacturer auto glass, then you need aftermarket glass made by an OEM manufacturer.

 
SAME PROCESS

TOP QUALITY

LOWER COST

PACKAGING SOLUTIONS

Comar Packaging Solutions is a premier supplier of stock, made-to-order, and custom designed primary packaging and dispensing solutions for a continuum of health and wellness applications.

DISCOVER MORE
 
Plastics Manufacturing Solutions
To Help Enhance and Extend Lives
Comar is a contract manufacturing partner for healthcare companies worldwide and a leading provider of primary packaging and dispensing products. Through a distinct blend of fresh thinking, engineering edge, and customer focus, we bring transformative plastic solutions from concept to reality, where they can positively impact the world around us.
UNIQUE SET OF MOLDING TECHNOLOGIES

Our unmatched toolkit of molding technologies enables us to create products and components in a wide range of materials, shapes, sizes, and tolerances. Our capabilities include injection molding, injection blow molding, extrusion blow molding, and injection stretch blow molding.

View Molding Technologies

COAST-TO-COAST COVERAGE

Our network of manufacturing and engineering facilities is strategically distributed to be close to you and your supply chain partners. With our continuous expansion of plants, capabilities, and teams, we are well-positioned to support your current needs and future growth. Proximity means local relationships, reduced transportation costs, just-in-time deliveries, and a partner you can interact with face-to-face.

View Locations

 

CONCEPT TO COMMERCIALIZATION

Our process begins with obtaining an in-depth understanding of your strategy and objectives to set the foundation for mutual success. With Innovation & Design Center teams that are ready to assist with custom design and product development, we partner with you to work as one team to move quickly from concept to commercialization.

View Design Services

SOLUTION-ORIENTED EXPERTISE

We have earned a reputation as a partner you can rely on. Our 75 years of experience have consistently focused on solving ever more complex issues in the medical and healthcare markets. Building on a foundation of hard-earned trust and unwavering quality standards, we respond to manufacturing challenges and regulatory hurdles with creative solutions and robust processes to keep you on track and on time.

Explore Partnering With Us

Join an energetic, collaborative workplace that fosters camaraderie, innovation, and exceptional service, where we celebrate individual creativity and initiative, advance aspirations, and protect health and well-being.

EXPLORE CAREERS

For 75 years, we have partnered with our clients to launch high-impact packaging and medical solutions—transforming them from concept to reality, where they can positively impact the world around us.

ABOUT US PRODUCTS SERVICE MANUALS CAREERS SUPPLY CHAIN
WELCOME TO MEKRA LANG NORTH AMERICA

MEKRA Lang North America (MLNA), an independent company of the MEKRA Group, is the leading manufacturer of rear view vision systems for commercial vehicles. This North American facility also houses the primary engineering, research and design operations for the Western Hemisphere.

Behind the doors of its growing 160,000 square foot facility in Ridgeway, South Carolina, the story of MLNA unfolds every day in the lives of its employees and the quality of their work. As a technology-based company, with its focus on innovation and the design of high-quality products, the MEKRA Group has achieved a position of global leadership within the industry.

From its founding in 1994, MLNA has grown from a management team of five employees to a workforce of more than 200. Fully-equipped engineering, quality and testing departments support the development of new design and product innovations for customers worldwide. With the addition of an expanded administrative area in May 1999 and plant expansions in 2000, 2002, 2003, 2004, and 2006, MLNA looks to the future with the capability to address the growing needs of current and prospective customers.

Perhaps the most striking impression a visitor to MLNA will get is the sense of ‘family’ amongst its employees, which is at the root of the company's history and growth. The original company, established in Fuerth, Germany in 1932, was the vision of its founders, Hans and Frieda Lang.

When a company begins by valuing its employees, everyone benefits. MLNA produces the world's highest quality, most technologically advanced mirror systems for a growing list of customers. MLNA has achieved ISO 9001, ISO 14001, IATF 16949 and ISO/IEC 17025 certifications. In 1999 and 2002 MEKRA Lang was named 'South Carolina's Manufacturer of the Year' for its outstanding dedication to product quality.

EUROPEAN GLASS MANUFACTURER
Stoelzle Glass Group

Stoelzle Glass Group can rely on more than 200 years of expertise as manufacturer of high-end glass containers. The Stoelzle network comprises seven manufacturing plants, three decoration sites and several sales offices worldwide. We serve our customers with excellent primary packaging made of the sustainable material glass. The vast sortiment includes premium glass products for the pharmaceutical, prestige spirits and food industry as well as for perfumery and cosmetic goods. Moreover, laboratory consumables and instruments, medical products as well as lab glassware are offered in Stoelzle’s Medical Laboratory division.

Manufacturing of glass packaging

We are passionate about manufacturing outstanding bottles from the inert material glass. Our machines run 24/7 in order to create stunning, award winning glass bottles.

One stop shop

Each product is different, unique in itself and therefore also requires individual service. At Stoelzle, it is important to us to offer you a complete solution that goes far beyond the product. Our experienced team will be happy to help you find the right packaging for your product. To ensure that your product is optimally packaged and presented from start to finish, we offer everything from a single source – whether it’s closures, decoration or the joint development of a customised glass shape.

Meeting the needs of the aerospace industry

PPG’s aerospace business is a leading provider of innovative solutions for the aerospace industry. With a strong focus on quality, reliability and sustainability, PPG offers a wide range of products and services tailored to meet the unique needs of aerospace OEMs and engineers. Our comprehensive portfolio includes advanced coatings, sealants, transparencies and chemicals, designed to enhance performance, durability and safety of aircraft.

PPG's commitment to innovation is evident through continuous development of advanced technologies that address industry challenges and drive efficiency. With a global presence and a reputation for excellence, PPG is the trusted partner for aerospace professionals seeking superior solutions and engineering expertise.

About

Catalyst Acoustics Group is the parent company of an elite group of acoustic, seismic, vibration and noise control brands that together, offer the broadest portfolio of noise control solutions in the market today.

The independent brands, channels to market, products and services offered by each business remain unique, while leveraging the deep functional expertise, broad channel reach, significant financial resources and much larger scale of the combined Catalyst Acoustics Group.

Catalyst Acoustics Group Brands

Established in 1958 as industrial consultants focused on controlling sound and vibration, Kinetics now produces the industry’s largest selection of innovative products and solutions to control airborne noise, isolate structure-borne vibration, enhance room acoustics, create quiet spaces, and restrain non-structural building systems.

Location: Dublin, OH

Visit Kinetics

Fräsch was founded with a vision to create beautiful, yet functional products that help reduce unwanted noise and elevate the acoustical properties of any space. We deliver on this vision with a wide range of custom and existing products formed from eco-friendly PET felt and premium felts.

Location: Arlington, TX

Visit Frasch

IAC Acoustics offers Acoustic metal solutions for Industrial, Architectural and Medical Applications. The industrial offering includes both in-plant and outdoor enclosures, outdoor noise barriers, anechoic chambers, Dyno Rooms and HVAC products. The architectural products include secure facilities, acoustical doors, windows, music practice rooms and studio packages. The Medical line includes audiology booths & test chambers.

Location: Naperville, IL

Visit IAC Acoustics

Sound Seal is a leading manufacturer of commercial and architectural acoustic noise control products and offers a wide product selection to the soundproofing industry. Sound Seal has been committed to controlling noise in every environment since 1978. With over 40 years of noise expertise, Sound Seal can offer the technical support and know how to solve any noise problem.

Location: Agawam, MA

Visit Sound Seal

Noise Barriers offers acoustical metal solutions to the noise control market. The Noise Barriers product family includes architectural doors, industrial doors, windows, barrier systems, absorption panels, complete enclosure systems, audio-metric exam rooms, music practice rooms, and specialty products.

Location: Lake Forest, IL

Visit Noise Barriers

Lamvin is a leading United States-based manufacturer of quality, custom architectural acoustical products. Based in Oceanside, California, Lamvin manufactures premium acoustical products to order. From basic panel options, to original, creative noise control solutions limited only by your imagination.

Location: Oceanside, CA

Visit Lamvin

RealAcoustix prides itself on offering customization paired with top-notch customer service and satisfaction. Known in the industry for producing high-end diffusers, acoustical wood and absorption treatments, RealAcoustix’s products have been successfully installed in concert halls, universities, premier recording studios and other high-end spaces with notable aesthetic and acoustic results.   

Location: Ogden, UT

Visit RealAcoustix

Madrid Acoustics has been crafting quality wood products since 1977 and architectural ceilings and wood elements for well over a decade. From sustainably harvested wood, Madrid creates innovative three-dimensional products that complement your design. Our attractive and versatile product lines can complement your design and provide optional sound reflection or absorption.

Location: Pico Rivera, CA

Visit Madrid

WELCOME TO GLASSWERKS
PREMIER FABRICATOR OF CUSTOM GLASS PRODUCTS

For over three decades, the custom glass fabrication experts at Glasswerks have been producing a wide range of custom and architectural glass products for customers in the Los Angeles, San Diego, and Las Vegas areas, as well as Hawaii. Our highly-talented team of experienced glass fabrication professionals deliver unmatched customer service and the highest levels of responsiveness in the industry, while our innovative products and cutting-edge glass fabrication capabilities make us your ideal partner for virtually any architectural or other custom glass project.

LEARN ABOUT US 


GLASS FABRICATION CAPABILITIES

At Glasswerks, we offer full-service custom glass fabrication services, producing a comprehensive range of architectural and other custom glass products. Our custom glass fabrication capabilities include a wide range of edge beveling, tempered glass cutting, sandblasting, grooving, and much more. We have all of the world-class machinery and highly-experienced custom glass fabricators needed to create the exact product you need with the utmost quality, precision, and reliability. OUR COMPETENCE

Smart Mobility Solutions
We Offer Multi-Modal Transportation Management for a Connected World.




Cities are commonly referred to as the engines of economic growth. Hence there is an urgent need for cities to find smarter ways to handle large-scale urbanization and find new ways to adapt to new situations, manage complexity, increase efficiency, reduce their ecological footprint, engage citizens, reduce expenses, and improve quality of life for everybody.

The smart city becomes an extended and heterogeneous mix of systems and services, where mobility represents a supporting pillar.
SWARCO is supporting smart city growth by guiding the development of its products and solutions towards a new mobility management concept.

COMPANY HISTORY:

 

Murakami Manufacturing USA, Inc. is a subsidiary of Murakami Corporation, a 135 year old global company with headquarters in Shizuoka, Japan.

Murakami established their North American operations in Campbellsville, Kentucky in 2000. The facility manufactures exterior rearview mirrors for a variety of automotive manufacturers.

After multiple expansions, the latest being in 2018, the 200,000 square feet facility employees over 300 team members working in injection molding, paint, assembly and other manufacturing related departments.

The vision of Murakami Manufacturing USA, Inc. is to be a “Supplier of Choice” to our customers and an “Employer of Choice” in the community. Murakami expects “greatness” from each and every team member and our standard is to treat people how you would want to be treated.

Murakami is very proud to be part of the Campbellsville and Taylor County community.

Murakami Manufacturing USA, Inc. Philosophy               

 

Why We Do It

The vision of Murakami Manufacturing U.S.A., Inc. is to be known by our customers as their “Supplier of Choice” and in the community as the “Employer of Choice.”

What We Do

Establish an organization that is focused on safety; that is independent, self-sufficient, and capable of delivering quality products and sustained profits so that we can be a source of support to our customers and provide a livelihood to our team members for many years to come.

How We Do It

Work Safe; Build Quality Products; Protect the Environment; Operate to Key Performance Indicators (KPI), Establish a culture where greatness is expected, Kaizen (continuous improvement) is a way of life and treating others like you want to be treated is the standard.

The vision of Murakami Manufacturing USA, Inc. is to be a “Supplier of Choice” to our customers and an “Employer of Choice” in the community.

In 2008 Murakami was awarded the Chamber of Commerce Manufacturing Business of the Year. Central Kentucky voters named Murakami Manufacturing Best Place to Work in 2014, 2015 and 2017.

About Us

Arkansas Glass Container Corporation, located in Jonesboro, Arkansas, has been on the same property since 1948. Originally built to produce minnow-roach bait traps, a change in ownership and the company name in the mid-1950s resulted in a shift to food-grade containers -- a product that we still produce today. Proud to be American owned, Arkansas Glass Container Corporation, makes glass containers ranging from 8 ounces to one-gallon. We also offer a family of patented designed containers called the Stout, used for sauces, beverages or dressings.

Steel Encounters delivers innovative solutions for a wide range of commercial building types. As a specialty subcontractor, we collaborate with customers and building partners to deliver exceptional results on each project. 

​

As an employee-owned company, Steel Encounters'

commitment to innovation, quality, and safety has driven our success since 1985.​​

Our Services
Special Projects
Specialty Commercial, Luxury Residential, Temples, Art Glass, Cladding Systems, Skylights

Our Special Projects team completes projects such as operable glass doors, glass partitions, skylights, historic storefront, and a variety of post installation services.
Learn More
Architectural Division
Curtainwall, Cladding Systems, Building Facades, Architectural Products

As a facade contractor, we provide glass curtainwall, storefront, and other cladding systems in a variety of materials. We are also a dealer representative for a variety of related building products.
Learn More
Structural Division
Value-Added Steel Joist and Deck Material Supplier, In-House Detailing, Budget Pricing, Logistics

At a time when experience, accuracy, and the ability to maximize resources are critical, consider us your one-stop shop for steel joist and deck materials. 
 
Learn More
OUR MISSION
Building successful partners and employee-owners.
OUR VISION

To be the premier company and most sought-after provider of structural and building envelope products and services.
 

CORE VALUES

Humble, Hungry,
Respectful, Quality,
Honor Commitments

A Culture of Safety 

At Steel Encounters, safety isn't just a value; it’s the foundation of everything we do. We believe that a safe environment fosters trust, encourages productivity, and protects everyone who interacts with our services. 

​

We are dedicated to maintaining the highest safety standards through rigorous training, proactive risk management, and adherence to industry regulations. By fostering a culture of safety, we not only prevent incidents but also ensure that every interaction with Steel Encounters is one you can trust.

 

Safety isn’t just about meeting standards—it's about exceeding them and creating an environment where everyone feels secure and valued.

​

	Welcome

Welcome to the home page of AGC Electronics America in Hillsboro Oregon USA: a manufacturer of SiC, CMP, EUV Blanks, and more.

At AGC Electronics America, we specialize in high-purity, high-strength Silicon Carbide (SiC) products, known for their low thermal expansion and excellent resistance to heat and acids. With over 30 years of experience, our SiC products are essential in semiconductor manufacturing, LED, solar cell, and SiC power device applications.

We also deliver advanced slurries and polishing solutions for CMP processes, optimizing for high planarization and selectivity control across various materials, including silicon-based, metals, and resins. Our fully integrated manufacturing ensures top-quality results for semiconductor front-end, back-end, and packaging processes.

As the world’s only manufacturer of EUVL mask blanks handling every aspect from glass materials to coating, our products are trusted by leading logic and memory semiconductor manufacturers for their superior technology and quality.

Join us in driving innovation and excellence in the semiconductor industry. Explore exciting career opportunities and become a part of our team by visiting our career page for a list of current openings.

WELCOME TO ARGLASS:
WE MAKE BOTTLES ON YOUR TERMS.
YOUR BOTTLE IS YOUR CALLING CARD

Whether you’re a small-batch distiller, a start-up producer, a long-standing household name, or something in between, we all know that it’s what’s inside the bottle that counts.

But here’s something else we all recognize: it’s your container that makes the first impression. It sets you apart – on the shelf, and in the mind of your customers.

And for too long, the big-time container manufacturers have treated producers as an afterthought.

Not anymore. Welcome to Arglass.

OUR CORE VALUES

The glass container industry is dominated by manufacturers that cater to the behemoths. That means you have to put in bigger orders than you want. Tolerate long runs. And endure delay after delay.

But with Arglass, you get:

Just about any shape.
Just about any color.
No large-volume requirements.
Exactly what you want. Imagine that!

With our brand-new next-generation US-based plant, Arglass is out to change everything about the way bottlers, distillers and food manufacturers – from small and mid-sized producers to the largest companies in their industry – create best-in-class bottles and containers.

OUR FOUNDING PRINCIPLES
FLEXIBILITY

We pride ourselves on being lean, nimble and responsive to our customers’ needs, no matter how rapidly they might change. Shape, color, size, quantity: we’re in business to say yes.

EFFICIENCY

Our new plant is built to optimize everything about glass container production, from new product design to energy consumption. We produce the highest quality containers with the most efficient use of time and resources (both ours and yours).

SUSTAINABILITY

As focused as we are on what we produce, we’re equally concerned with how we produce it.

Sustainability is one of our founding principles because manufacturing the highest quality glass containers means using the best technology to reduce our environmental impact, eliminate industrial waste water, minimize energy consumption, and use renewable and recycled materials throughout the manufacturing process.

At Arglass, we share our clients’ commitment to high quality products and smooth, efficient, sustainable processes.

OUR PLANT HAS BEEN DESIGNED TO PRODUCE CONTAINERS IN ALMOST ANY SHAPE AND COLOR WITHOUT LARGE-VOLUME COMMITMENTS. YOU CAN ALSO FIND INSPIRATION IN OUR DISRUPTIVE CATALOG.

Choose the Right Insulation for Your Home

 

Wrap Your Home in Comfort

 

Your home is a place of comfort, peace, and security. But choosing the wrong insulation for your home could threaten that sanctuary of warmth.

Keep temperature extremes from invading your living space, reduce or eliminate drafts, and increase the efficiency of your air conditioning and heating systems by choosing the professionals at NCI Insulation.

 

Wrap Your Home in Peace

NCI Insulation has been helping homeowners make the right choice for insulation for over 46 years.

As a family owned and operated company with an A+ rating by the BBB, we have the expertise you need to enjoy peace of mind in an energy-efficient home that will stand both the test of time and the worst of mother nature.

 

 

Wrap Your Home in Value

 

Insulation is an investment not only in the comfort of your home's interior but its value over time. The right insulation will provide energy savings year after year and basically pay for itself each month by reducing your utility bills.

With five different types of insulation, we can work together to find the solution that fits your needs.

Wrap Your Home in Insulation from NCI

Call today or schedule an onsite consultation with NCI Insulation. We'll send a pleasant, professional, uniformed employee to your home to do a physical walk-through. Unlike competitors, we don't "guesstimate" - our team members will actually go into the attic to give you an accurate quote and ensure you're informed about all of your options.

Call NCI Insulation today and discover how easy it is to enjoy true comfort in your home.

About

Carolina Filters, Inc. has been a supporter of mission-critical filtration applications for over half a century. Its journey began as an air filter service provider in the 1960s, and it later pioneered process equipment cleaning techniques for polymer melt filters in the 1980s.

True to its original slogan, “Committed to Quality Service,” Carolina Filters remains family-owned and operated, with three distinct and independent divisions: Carolina IAQ, Carolina PEC, and the newly formed Carolina Filter Supply division. Each division continues to deliver unparalleled customer service and innovative engineered solutions in the filtration industry.

QUALITY ENGINEERED COMPOSITES

Molded Fiber Glass Companies (MFG) is a leader in the composites industry with one of the largest full-service networks of custom molding and assembly facilities in North America. Headquartered in Ashtabula, OH, MFG has helped clients develop and improve their products, efficiency, and bottom line since 1948. We deliver excellence in manufacturing, design engineering support, R&D and program management. Our Best in Class quality and management practices make MFG a trusted supply partner to leading manufacturing companies.

LEARN MORE ABOUT MFG

70 YEARS AND STILL INNOVATING

Known as the original manufacturer of the fiber glass body for the iconic Corvette, MFG Companies prides itself as an innovative, family-owned enterprise that spans four generations of the Morrison family. Founded in 1948 by entrepreneur Robert S. Morrison, the company is headquartered in Ashtabula, Ohio, and remains one of the largest employers in the region.

Health & Wellness Packaging
Limitless packaging possibilities

You’ll get the best of both worlds: The capabilities of a large flexible packaging supplier, combined with the agility and dedicated service typical of a small converter.

State-of-the-art technology

HD flexographic printing. Matte and gloss printing effects. Leading reclose technology. In-house laser scoring, pouch converting, Inno-Lok® pre-zippered rollstock, cold seal application, and the list goes on.

Service built around your needs

You’ll have access to vendor-managed inventory (VMI), safety stock programs, ongoing plant-floor support, dedicated field support engineers, and more.

Many packaging products, one supplier

We’re your one-stop-shop for flexible packaging — enabling you to consolidate packaging suppliers. Fewer suppliers means lower transportation costs and less time spent coordinating vendor relationships.

Explore products
From concept to prototype in 2 weeks or less

With our in-house product development team, our clients get tremendous speed to market. Because we are fully integrated — with graphics, prepress, state-of-the-art plate making, and almost every finishing platform in-house — you get greater control throughout the process.

Explore capabilities
To us, sustainability is more than a buzzword

For brands that require recyclable packaging, we have mono-material, all-PE packaging products suitable for store drop-off programs. For brands wanting to source recycled materials, we offer PET with up to 90% post-consumer recycled (PCR) resin and PE with up to 44% PCR resin. From source reduction to compostability, we have solutions.

Our commitment to sustainability
Six decades of experience

We’ve been at this for 60 years, and we’ve seen trends come and go, printing technology evolve, and even our own portfolio of capabilities expand. We've mastered all things flexible packaging, and we aim to be your packaging problem solver.

Learn more about us
We don't guess what you need

We work closely with your company to develop custom packaging that fits within your budget, meets your performance requirements, and achieves your brand vision. And we don’t wait for packaging issues to arise — we have field tech engineers on your plant floor asking your team what’s working, what’s not, and refining our process accordingly.

Learn about our customer-centric process

Our product line offers a wide range of solutions for both simple and complex applications. Stahlin provides the marketplace’s most extensive in-stock and customized line of non-metallic enclosures and accessories, balancing appealing aesthetics with stringent physical property performance standards including NEMA 4X, NEMA 6P, IEC IP66 and IEC IP68 integrity.

Learn More
About Us

Throughout nearly 60 years, our innovation and proven quality have enabled us to lead the electrical products industry in designing, engineering and manufacturing world-class fiberglass, polycarbonate, and PVC electrical and instrumentation enclosures for diverse interior and exterior applications. As a proud U.S. manufacturer, we are the primary source producer of all our own enclosure components.

View Our Story
Modified Enclosures

We also provide our ModRight program: a service to engineers and designers for solving problems that standard off-the-shelf products cannot address. Lenoir Mirror Company



Welcome to Lenoir Mirror – U.S. Manufacturer of Quality Commercial Mirrors

Lenoir Mirror Company Manufactures Commercial Mirrors

Lenoir Mirror Company was founded in 1913 to serve the furniture industry in Western North Carolina. Our mirror and glass products are sold throughout the United States. The company’s primary function is as a mirror manufacturing operation which coats and fabricates flat glass. Customers include furniture manufacturers, medicine cabinet manufacturers, specialty manufacturers, mirror door manufacturers, mobile home distributors, glass distributors and mirror dealers, and construction supply distributors.


U.S. Manufacturers of Commercial Mirrors

Our mirror factory’s manufacturing operation consists of 260,000 square feet in three buildings, which are located at the company headquarters in Lenoir, North Carolina. Equipment includes a silver conveyor and a large array of beveling, edging, cutting, and grooving fabrication equipment. In addition to a variety of fabrication capacity, the company offers a wide range of packaging options, including individual as well as bulk packaging.



State of the Art Mirror Manufacturing Technology

Lenoir Mirror Company – State of the Art Technology

Over the past 25 years, Lenoir Mirror Company has invested considerable capital in our information systems.

We developed a state of the art shop floor tracking system. Service is based upon the efficient movement of information. Our systems enable us to communicate both internally as well as with suppliers and customers in a manner that optimizes the service that we offer.


State of the Art Automated Glass and Mirror Cutting

Lenoir Mirror Company is one of the leading commercial mirror manufacturers in the domestic mirror and fabricated glass industry.

We have continued to invest in the latest machinery and equipment and will continue to serve our customers with state of the art production equipment.

Serving the Commercial and Residential Markets since 1990


Commercial

American Insulated Glass offers a complete range of glass solutions designed for exterior and interior commercial building applications. Certified by the world’s leading manufacturers of high-performance glass—Cardinal, Guardian, AGC, Vetrotech and Saint Gobain, architects have ease of access to advanced glazing solutions that support energy efficiency, life-safety and fire-safety design requirements combined with quality assurance.

Residential

Certified by the Insulating Glass Certification Council (IGCC) and the Safety Glazing Certification Council (SGCC), AIG has created an outstanding reputation in the residential and commercial markets by supplying the most energy efficient coated glass options available in today’s market. The breadth of our product range, spacer and muntin options—and, service excellence keep us at the forefront of the residential glazing industry.

Millwork

Founded on supplying quality glass tempered and insulating glass for millwork windows and doors, AIG continues to thrive in this market segment by providing intricate and unique options, including beveled and decorative glass. Our custom fabrication capabilities allow us to accept templates or DXF files with shapes available beyond the standard range. The millwork industry can rely on American Insulated Glass.









A.L. Smith Glass was acquired by AIG in December 2019. Originally founded by Alton and Joyce Smith, A.L. Smith Glass has been serving the glass and glazing industry for nearly five decades—adding state-of-art technology and expanding its fabricated glass capabilities to meet the growing demand in the North megalopolis that includes the Washington, D.C. area. View Press Release




Great Lakes Glass Distributors, is now part of the American Insulated Glass family of businesses. Located near Detroit, the company is a glass fabricator and wholesale distributor known for its dedication to serving glazing contractors throughout Michigan, northern Ohio and northwest Indiana, providing a complete line of flat glass and insulating glass capabilities. AIG is making multiple equipment upgrades to this facility to position them to more effectively service both commercial and residential building applications. View Press Release





Innovative Glass of America (IGA) was acquired by AIG in late 2018. Formerly owned by Louie Dean, this North Carolina-based glass fabricator and wholesale distributor is well-known to glazing contractors and architects throughout the Southeast. IGA has been rebranded as American Insulated Glass and will continue to service customers with an array of flat glass and specialty glazing solution for commercial and residential building applications. View Press Release

ABOUT US
About us

At INFINITY GLASS CONCEPTS LLC, as a high-performance glass manufacturer and supplier, we are proud to offer high-quality glass products for a wide range of industries and applications. With years of experience in the glass manufacturing industry, we have built a strong reputation for excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction. We produce flat glass sheets that are used for windows, doors, mirrors, glass partitions, and various architectural applications. If you’ve got a tough engineering or application challenge that requires high-performance glass, you’ve come to the right place. Maybe you need a custom product in a complex shape with tight dimensional or geometric tolerances. Our flat glass is available in different sizes, thicknesses, and finishes to meet the specific requirements of each project. we’ve engineered glass to perform in some of the harshest environments on earth.
Every detail is analyzed—from the selection of raw materials to your specific requirements — so we can develop glass compositions and manufacture glass products that exceed your expectations.
Our mission is to provide top-quality glass solutions that meet the unique needs of our customers. We are dedicated to delivering products that are not only aesthetically pleasing but also durable, functional, and safe. We understand the importance of glass in various industries, from automotive and construction to interior design and architectural projects.





INFINITY GLASS CONCEPTS LLC

We understand the importance of glass in various industries, from automotive and construction to interior design and architectural projects. We work closely with you to determine your best option based on your application and its specific needs.

READ MORE










Contact INFINITY GLASS CONCEPTS LLC, when:

Your application requires a durable material that must resist prolonged exposure to harsh environmental forces – abrasion, corrosive chemicals, extreme heat and cold, or impact while maintaining performance requirements.
The material you choose must be able to be formed into a complex shape and be manufactured cost-effectively in small lots.
The ability to focus, transmit or absorb light at targeted wavelengths is required without the material degrading or weakening after prolonged exposure to environmental and application stresses.

The largest specialty vehicle windshield glass supplier in the industry.

With more than 40 years in the auto glass business, Coach Glass understands specialty glass applications. We are your industry partner and want to help you grow your business. Whether you are an original equipment manufacturer or in need of aftermarket glass, we are here to help. We stock a large variety of glass products from windshield glass to side glass for motorized and towable recreational vehicles, fire apparatus vehicles, charter bus and motorcoaches, school buses, transit vehicles, heavy equipment, medical vehicles and much more. We are also equipped to source the highest quality glass for high-speed and light rail applications. Get a quote for your desired glass product or contact us to talk about your product development needs.

WHAT SETS US APART
STELLAR CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE

When you call Coach Glass, a real person answers the phone, never an automated answering service. Our seasoned customer service representatives and sales team are ready to listen to your needs and find the best solution for you and your company.  Learn More.

PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT

Coach Glass is skilled in product design, waste reduction, supply-chain analysis, packaging design and much more. Explore our capabilities and partner with our engineering team. 

FAST, RELIABLE SHIPPING

We take pride in offering you the best shipping record in the industry. With a product like glass, making sure your shipment arrives quickly and without damage is critical. That is why we have developed proprietary packaging to accommodate all orders, large and small. Most orders ship the same day!

LOGISTIC COVERAGE

We have the inventory and warehousing space to stock, package and ship your product so you don’t have to. Our longstanding relationships with our freight partners and our glass handling expertise save you money and time. Learn More.

UNRIVALLED INVENTORY

We stock more than 18,000 products for RV and specialty vehicles including windshields, side glass, back glass, moldings, gaskets and more. We are your best source for old and discontinued glass and accessories.

 Renowned Quality and Service

For over 65 years we’ve provided our customers with most innovative choices in floor coverings.  Today that means a wide-variety of flooring options: hardwood to concrete, carpet to vinyl.

As a family-run business for 3 generations, our decades of experience combined with a one-stop shop means our customers get all their flooring needs met . . . done right and always done on time.

Polished Concrete

Stunning, durable and LEED approved, our polished concrete process gives you a myriad of choices for lasting beauty for new concrete or retrofits.

Restoration
Need new floors?  Maybe not.  Our unique restoration process can often renew and beautify your older flooring, saving you time and money.
Flooring
Carpets that are exquisite; hardwoods and laminate that are impressive and durable; and functional vinyls that are still highly attractive.  With hundreds of choices, we have the exact right flooring for you.
Moisture Mitigation
Quick project?  Little time for concrete drying?  Our moisture mitigation process can save the day and preserves your warranty with flooring manufacturers.
YOUR FLOORING PARTNER | YOUR ONE STOP SHOP

Every business is different and we recognize that your flooring needs are unique.  At Anderson, we sit down with you to fully understand both your flooring needs and your business needs.

Then we apply our decades of experience to help you achieve the right balance of beauty and durability, to meet the particular challenges of your commercial space.

Finally, because we are vertically integrated, we can be with you from the time you have an idea for the project to long after the install is completed, giving you a stress-free experience.  As one of our long-standing customers said,  “We don’t worry about you guys.”

 

Consider us your one-stop shop and take advantage of all or some of our services:

About Bucher
Emhart Glass

Bucher Emhart Glass is a company with a rich heritage and a tradition of excellence that we are proud to continue today.

Read more

Made to Perform

End to End is a unique set of solutions, products and services designed to make glass production easier, safer and more efficient. It addresses all the challenges of glass makers and helps to keep the glass industry attractive.

Find out more
Latest News

Advance Your Skills

eAcademy+

eAcademy+ delivers effective learning by integrating Bucher Emhart Glass expertise with cutting-edge techniques from the University of Marburg. Our training includes videos, comprehension tests, and 3D models, providing a certified, scientifically-backed degree. This helps employees master essential processes and maintain high standards in the glass industry.

Optimize Operating Conditions

Utility+

Utility+ can offer a customized utility definition for machine projects, supporting our customers in accurately calculating utilities based on their factory location. This ensures precise interpretation of our documentation, effective resource consumption aligned with production needs, optimised operating conditions, reduced costs, and the prevention of production limitations. 

Maximise Your Equipment Performance And Lifetime

Parts+

Parts+ offers Original Parts to maximize equipment performance and lifetime. With rapid availability and high-quality materials, we ensure smooth and precise movements, minimal downtime, and optimized production speeds. Customers can access parts information online, ensuring quick delivery and efficient repairs.

Enhance Production Efficiency

Automation+

We understand the importance of reliable automation equipment, which is why we are committed to providing the best possible support for all your needs. Our specialists have the expertise and experience to help you get the most out of your equipment and keep your production running smoothly. 

Improve Plant Performance

Maintenance+

Our Maintenance Support products target the heart of day-to-day plant life and ensures the condition and performance of your assets are at its optimum. Our Maintenance philosophies and guidance are a result of years of technological experience within the glass container industry.

Posted: May 16, 2024
Window Technology, Inc (WinTech) Announces Acquisition of Pocahontas Aluminum Company: Strengthening Market Position and Growth Opportunities

[Monett, MO, May 16, 2024] – WinTech, a leading provider of materials to the construction industry, today announced the acquisition of 100% of the stock of Pocahontas Aluminum Company, a prominent window and door manufacturer based in Pocahontas, Arkansas. The acquisition, effective May 9, 2024, marks a significant milestone in WinTech's strategic growth initiatives and underscores the company's commitment to expanding its market presence and fostering further growth for the benefit of the employee-owners.

Pocahontas Aluminum Company, established in 1963, has built a strong reputation for excellence in the modular home, food truck, deer blind, and other industries, serving customers with dedication and integrity for over six decades. Pocahontas Aluminum Company has been a cornerstone of the Pocahontas community, contributing to local economic growth and prosperity.

Commenting on the acquisition, Jack Williams, President of WinTech, expressed his enthusiasm for the partnership between the two companies. "We are thrilled to welcome Pocahontas Aluminum Company into the WinTech family," said Williams. "This acquisition represents an exciting opportunity to combine the strengths and expertise of two great companies, driving greater value for our customers and employee-owners. Together, we will leverage our collective resources and capabilities to improve customer solutions and enhance our competitive position in the market."

The acquisition of Pocahontas Aluminum Company aligns with WinTech's strategic vision to broaden its product portfolio, expand its customer base, and drive sustainable growth. With the addition of Pocahontas Aluminum Company, WinTech aims to capitalize on synergies, optimize operational efficiencies, and deliver enhanced value propositions to customers across various industries.

As part of the acquisition, WinTech remains committed to preserving the legacy and values that have defined Pocahontas Aluminum Company over the years. The company will continue to operate under the Pocahontas Aluminum Company brand, maintaining its presence in Pocahontas and honoring its longstanding relationships with customer and vendor partners.

For more information about WinTech and Pocahontas Aluminum Company, please visit: wintechinc.com and pocahontasaluminum.com.

About WinTech:

WinTech is a leading provider of innovative solutions in the building materials industry. With a strong commitment to quality, performance, and customer satisfaction, WinTech delivers high quality products and services that drive success for their clients. As an employee-owned company, their dedicated team takes pride in delivering exceptional results while maintaining the highest standards of professionalism and integrity.

About Pocahontas Aluminum Company:

Pocahontas Aluminum Company, located in Pocahontas, Arkansas, was founded by Mr. Edd Rose in 1963. The company was later purchased by Mr. Rose's son, L. D. Rose and wife Frances. Under the leadership of L.D., the company experienced significant growth by expanding its initial product line beyond storm doors and windows. Strategic decisions, such as establishing distributorships and diversifying product offerings across multiple markets within the construction industry, have contributed to the company's remarkable success.

In the intricate world of building enclosures, where aesthetics meets functionality, Kovach stands tall. As one of the nation’s most prominent integrated designers, manufacturers, and installers, our expertise in architectural wall panels and glazing systems is unmatched.
WHY KOVACH
Excellence in Every Envelope, Punctuality in Every Project
Kovach is your comprehensive solution for all building envelope needs. Be it bespoke metal panels, an intricate architectural shade system, or a sophisticated curtain wall, we've got it mastered. Harnessing cutting-edge technology and advanced equipment, we guarantee unparalleled quality and precision in both product and installation. KOVACH RECOGNIZED WITH AMERICAN SUBCONTRACTOR ASSOCIATION 2022 SAFETY AWARD
In ASA’s commitment to safety, the decision was made to recognize those members who make safety and safety education a priority in their company.  The companies recognized are those who have gone above and beyond to ensure their employees, and everyone on their jobsites, go home to their families after work every day.
Read More
AZ BIG MEDIA: KOVACH COMPLETES NEW SKIN FOR FOOTPRINT CENTER
Kovach collaborated with design architect HOK to deliver the new exterior screening system for the Phoenix Suns’ Footprint Center in downtown Phoenix – “designed to make the wall panels look like rippling water when the wind blows and, alternatively, blaze on fire when the sun strikes.” The 130,000 kinetic, 6 inch by 6 inch aluminum flaps move independently and span 45,000-square-feet.
Read More
BEST HIGHER EDUCATION/RESEARCH EXCELLENCE IN SAFETY, AWARD: UTD SCIENCES
Kovach coordinated with multiple contractors to complete the $79.6-million University of Texas at Dallas Sciences Building. Features of this 187,200-sq-ft structure include a scrim exterior facade that required installation of hundreds of horizontal steel supports and a steel-tube framework.
Read More

The expert for all glass-ceramic solutions

EuroKera was born in 1990 at the heart of France and founded by two of the most prestigious manufacturing companies in the world: Saint-Gobain and Corning Inc. Benefiting from their centuries-old and unequaled resources, we deliver premium materials ensuring top quality and outstanding customer service.

At EuroKera, we work hard every day to provide the best solutions for cooking, fireplaces, and all other relevant applications. We constantly innovate and collaborate with our clients to make the boldest and most elegant designs a reality. The collaboration between our experts and our customers is crucial to us. It is by working together closely that we all succeed and create masterpieces.

You have a project integrating glass-ceramic, and EuroKera has a solution.

We create and deliver glass-based solutions for trains, automobiles, buses and other vehicles. Our state-of-the-art glass systems include windscreens, side windows, supporting housings, frames, gaskets and installation and support. We also develop custom windows and unique glass compositions.

Learn More
		
Special Applications

Our special glass solutions include glass-embedded passenger information systems, and lightweight anti-vandal and impact-resistant glass systems. We also develop architectural and solar glass, curved and special blends, heated glass and switchable smart glass.

Quality – Quality is at the core of everything we do. We invest in continually improving the quality of our products, production technologies and work processes.

Kensington Glass Arts, Inc.
The Leading fabricator of architectural glass in the Washington-Baltimore Area.

Kensington Glass Arts (KGa), based in Ijamsville, Maryland and Sterling, Virginia, has officially completed the process of sunsetting their Contract Glazing Division.

This strategic move is aimed at concentrating all company resources and efforts on their Glass Fabrication Division, which has been highly successful since its establishment in 2002. The Glass Fabrication Division specializes in the fabrication of heavy tempered and laminated glass, catering to various aspects of the architectural industry. Their products include fabricated glass for kitchen and bath, architectural interior and exterior glazing systems, handrails, balustrades, and various commercial glazing applications.

KGa has chosen to maintain the technical and engineering expertise they have developed over thirty-five years in the industry, which includes the installation of a wide range of glazing in commercial projects. This expertise has been restructured into what is now known as the Technical Sales Team. The role of this team is to enhance the company's fabrication and sales processes by providing complex glass and hardware packages, which include shower door hardware and various types of glass doors, as well as offering unique hardware to complement their glass sales.

KGa's extensive experience as a commercial glazier allows them to offer unparalleled customer service and logistical support. They are committed to delivering high-quality, fabricated glass products with aggressive lead times to clients in the glazing, shower door, and architectural sectors on the East Coast. The company believes that by transitioning to a dedicated Glass Fabrication business model, they will be able to focus more effectively on their work, expand their geographical reach, and provide a level of service and support that is uncommon in the industry. This shift is expected to address common challenges such as lead times, logistics, and quality issues that are faced by glass shops, commercial glaziers, and glass wall dealers.
