B&K Installations has more than 35 years of experience in the manufacturing of cultivation and grow facilities for the horticulture, agriculture and aquaculture industries, as well as metal products that are used in various industries. Our engineers have perfected the design of reliable commercial structures and machined and fabricated products that are constructed to withstand extreme weather conditions and rigorous everyday use. Our state of the art manufacturing facility allows us to specialize in customization of structures and products that are specifically made to meet our customers’ needs and budget. With our state of the art water jet, staying on budget is easier than ever.
 
Why Pick B&K?

ABOUT DARE

Dare Products, Inc. was born because the founder, Robert M. Wilson, saw the need for an electric fence post as well as a more convenient method of selling electric fence wire to farmers.

From our humble beginning in 1946, in a small downtown office in Battle Creek, Michigan, Dare Products has become a cornerstone in the industry–offering a full line of electric fencing equipment and other related agricultural products. Many of our employees have been with the company for over 40 years, including company president Robert Wilson Jr.

Having been shaped by a rich tradition of long relationships with our customers, suppliers, and employees, Dare will continue to strive to offer quality products and friendly service in the years to come.

Our basic philosophy is quite simple: to manufacture and provide quality products resulting in lasting relationships with our customers. Many of our customers have been with Dare for over 60 years.

Dare manufactures the majority of our products, ensuring the highest quality. We will not sacrifice quality by importing a less expensive, inferior product.

Our Vision

The Green Planet Dubai wins IAAPA Brass Ring Awards for Innovative Training Programme

A ground-breaking new attraction in the UAE, The Green Planet Dubai, has won one of IAAPA’s prestigious Brass Ring awards for its innovative training programme. The Green Planet Dubai rainforest attraction is part of the Meraas Leisure & Entertainment division’s offering. Operated by the zoOceanarium Group, the attraction won Best Innovation in a Training Program (Class 2 Annual Attendance less than 1 million). The award was tied with New Zealand’s Rainbow’s End. The popular theme park was recognised for its in-house “Pillars of Leadership” programme. ‘

If the Dallas City Council acts fast, this beloved attraction could be open in time for the State Fair

The State Fair of Texas, which just announced its 2021 return, isn’t the only Fair Park tenant with big news. Come September, Big Tex may be saying howdy to a new and improved Children’s Aquarium — if Dallas City Hall doesn’t dawdle in its decision-making. The historic 1936 aquarium, the oldest in the state, has existed on borrowed time since the City Council voted in September that — given its unabated financial losses — closure was the only option.

Learn More 

Modern Ceramics Manufacturing fabricates precision machined ceramic components for the semiconductor, solar, medical, aerospace, and oil and gas industries. With our in-house machine shop, we also produce precision machined plastic and metal parts. Our clean room assembly capabilities allow us to offer turn-key manufacturing solutions.

Have you ever asked yourself or a vendor the following question?

"Why do I have to wait 6-8 weeks for parts that only require a
small amount of processing time?"

Modern's standard lead time for most parts is 4 weeks. However, when prototype or production volume parts are needed quickly, we eliminate long lead times with the development of our Advanced Manufacturing Program™ (AMP). When you need precision machined, high purity alumina ceramic components quickly, you need AMP. Depending on the lead time required, expedite fees may apply.

Submit RFQ 

24 hours or Less
Drawing review & quotation

THE  PROCESS
STAGE 1
The First 24 Hours
Order Enters AMP
Promise/Ship Date Set
From our multi-million dollar inventory of 96% - 99.85% alumina ceramic, the job is staged with material and work instructions
The required diamond cutting tools and/or wheels are selected from our extensive tool cabinets
CNC program is written
Fabrication of parts/Diamond grinding begins
STAGE 2
1-5 Days
Fabrication of parts/Diamond grinding
In process inspection
Depending on part complexity and lot size, our excess CNC and manual diamond milling, turning, and surface grinding capacity enables us to complete job in 1-5 days (including weekends if required).
STAGE 3
+1 Day
Assembly (if required)
Final Inspection
Laser Marking
In-house cleaning and packaging of parts (add 1 day for Class 100)
Parts Shipment
Modern Ceramics is a zero lag-time manufacturer.

We don't delay orders and our team members work with a sense of urgency.
Large lots or small, we possess an abundance of as-fired 96%, 99.5%, and 99.85% alumina ceramic material in stock.
Our excess of CNC and manual diamond grinding capacity make us capable of processing your order fast and efficiently.

Large Inventory of As-Fired Ceramic Materials

Modern Ceramics has invested in a multi-million dollar inventory of as-fired 96%, 99.5%, and 99.85% (semiconductor grade) alumina ceramic materials.

Exceptional Facility and Fabrication Capabilities.

Our skilled workforce is capable of fabricating precision ceramic, plastic, and metal components from simple to complex geometries in a 50,000 sf facility.

Proficient Engineering and Customer Service Support

Contact our applications and design engineering team today.We possess years of dedicated experience designing and manufacturing parts for the semiconductor, solar, medical, and oil and gas industries.

Contact one of our highly qualified team members.

Incepted off the premise of fabricating the most sought after glass known to industry experts, Opulux Glass is committed to providing unrivaled quality products at competitive pricing. Our dedication is exhibited not only though the world class equipment manufactures we have decided to team up with but more prominently through the expert glass professionals that work at our state of the art facility in East Hanover, New Jersey

 

PRODUCTS

Opulux stocks some of the world’s best quality raw material glass and has the capability to store and process more than 45 diverse types of glass, ranging in all sizes and thicknesses. Through the use of high quality raw materials, we can ensure a superior level of quality assurance and consistency when delivering final product to our ever demanding clients.

EQUIPMENT

 Investing in state of the art equipment was of utmost importance for Opulux upon formation. Accordingly, we have partnered solely with American and European machinery manufacturers who have proven themselves as industry leaders time and time again. This allows us to push the envelope with regards to producing excellent quality and precise end products clients can be proud to use.

CAPABILITIES

Opulux offers a wide range of services and capabilities to assist our clients with all of their glass fabrication needs from cutting to tempering and everything in between. Opulux is observant of the constant changes that effect the glass industry and accordingly adapt with times, always looking for opportunities in expanding our service lines to best serve our clients.

 

 

Investing In Only The Best Technology

Opulux is dedicated to producing the flattest, most aesthetically pleasing glass for our customers. Our dedication is what motivated us to invest in the Glaston FC500 tempering line. This engineering masterpiece was designed to temper all types of glass but specifically high performance low-e glass. On an average tempering line low-e glass would have a significant amount of distortion and roller wave. We take pride in knowing that we are able to surpass the strict tolerances and high quality glaziers and architects expect. 

In response to the demand for larger lites of glass, Opulux is equipped to temper glass up to 108"x 144”  Come take a tour of our facility and let us show you what Opulux can do.

Customized For You
A custom fabricated shower or bath enclosure will ensure a proper fit, an easier installation and it will help prevent leakage. Not to mention that you design the door you want based on the style and metal/glass selection.
Find Our Products Near You
In need of a shower door, a mirror or custom made piece of glass? We are proud that our Dealer Network extends throughout Wisconsin, Northern Illinois, and portions of the Upper Penisula of Michigan. Use the Dealer Locator link to find a dealer near you.
Experience That Matters
Wisconsin Shower Door has been offering bath and shower enclosures, including framed, frameless and heavy glass bath and shower enclosures. We have been serving dealers in Southeastern Wisconsin for over 50 years.
Who We Are
Since 1956 Wisconsin Shower Door has proudly set new standards of beauty in bath and interior design. We offer an exciting array of conventional and unique custom-made shower and bath enclosures, heavy glass enclosures, glass products, and mirrors, in a full range of colors, styles, and finishes. Whether it's new construction, remodeling, or just replacing, you’re assured of quality craftsmanship and unparalleled design flexibility with Wisconsin Shower Door.
Who We Serve
Starting in 2019, Wisconsin Shower Door transitioned away from the retail portion of our business to focus on providing custom glass and mirror fabrication to our qualified dealers throughout Wisconsin, Northern Illinois, and Michigan. We are pleased to point you toward our dealers to take care of your glass and mirror needs. Visit our Dealer Locator to find an excellent Wisconsin Shower Door dealer near you.
Flat Glass Products

Wisconsin Shower Door provides our dealers an exciting array of glass products and mirrors, in a range of colors and styles.

Shower Door Products

Our shower doors, bath enclosures and heavy glass enclosures are superbly crafted to meet your unique needs while providing a luxury that's easy to maintain. Sized and styled to coordinate with your decor and other fixtures, they're the perfect complement to the most imaginative design plans, whether contemporary or classic. They offer an elegance and durability that not only enhances the beauty of your bath but increases the value of your home as well.

Resources and Care

We offer a variety of products to help protect your investment. Keep your shower door sparkling with a few easy-to-use products.

EnduroShield is an ultra-thin transparent glass coating that completely adheres to the surface and provides protection that will repel both water and oil based stains. Similar to a non-stick fry pan, cleaning is made easier using a mild detergent or white vinegar with a damp microfiber cloth.

We uniquely combine ¼” and ⅜” glass to give this new enclosure a headerless option for your shower enclosure.

Foamtite interior storm windows are an excellent alternative to applying plastic to windows each year and are effective against damaging condensation on wood areas.

ABOUT HAWKINS GLASS
Mission Statement

Hawkins Glass Wholesalers, LLC strives to provide exceptional quality and unmatched customer service as we push to gain the respect and trust of or customers, suppliers and partners.

We are an ISO 9001:2015 certified company with a state department license for ITAR controlled items.

HGW has built its reputation on service to our many customers. We pride ourselves on upholding relationships with our loyal customers for 10, 20, 30, and even 40 years. This trust and support we provide to our customer base has been standard since 1932, and it has permitted HGW to grow and expand into the many fields of the glass industry.

We design, test and manufacture ballistic glass assemblies and transparent armor that help keep members of the U.S. military safe. Additionally, we provide a diverse range of security and architectural solutions to federal and state agencies, law enforcement, and the private sector.

To learn more about our capabilities and offerings, please contact us.

History

Hawkins Glass (HGW) was in the wholesale glass manufacturing and distribution fields until February 2012. It manufactured and distributed many products to multiple markets, including: bullet resistant, tempered, laminated and insulated glass, mirrors, table tops and obscure glass. HGW serves the local area while also shipping many products worldwide.

Hawkins Glass is a limited liability corporation based in Virginia. It was founded in 1932 & relocated from Washington, DC to Marlow Heights, MD in 1965. Under the direction of new management in the 1980s, HGW achieved significant growth & eventually relocated again to Waldorf, MD.

In 1998, Eastern Moulding, HGW’s wholesale picture frame division, was sold to Larson Juhl. Following the sale, HGW moved to Springfield, VA and moved into the manufacturing field. The steady growth in sales and customers created a need for more equipment and warehouse space, so HGW designed and built a warehouse in Stafford, VA in 2005. In 2001 the company entered the government contracting space as a provider of ballistic and military products, and moved that division to Lorton, VA to better address the security requirements of its customers. As the ballistics division grew, the flat glass division remained in Stafford, VA until it was sold to Grey Mountain Industries in February 2012. Since then, HGW has focused exclusively on its ballistic and military product lines.

Hawkins Glass has built its reputation on its stellar customer service. It takes pride on maintaining relationships with customers for up to 40 years. The trust and support that HGW provides its customer base has been the foundation on which the company has grown and diversified into many fields within the glass industry.

In addition to the required training for safety and machinery use and operation, employees are provided with intensive training for their specific job duties. Exceptional employees are cross-trained to allow them to step into multiple positions.

All products are purchased from several suppliers so that short-falls in inventory are avoided. HGW tries to use small businesses for sub-contracted items provided that the companies meet HGW’s quality standards and production schedule. On average, 65% or more of HGW’s subcontracting goes to small businesses.

CAPABILITIES

For more information, including a full list of our product offerings and capabilities, please contact us directly.

For half a century, Electro-Glass Products has manufactured glass preforms and glass products for electronics, sensors, and a variety of high-tech applications from satellite systems to medical implants.

Our primary products include glass preforms for over 18,000 different shapes and sizes, tubing and glassware, hot press heated glass, and spray dried or powdered glass.

The engineering team at Electro-Glass offered engineering assistance in developing new products, improving established products and procedures, and redesigning seal assemblies to reduce costs. We provide low-cost engineering test samples and complete confidentiality.

About Us

Electro-Glass Products was founded in 1973 as a manufacturer of glass insulators for the electronics industry. The original location was a small building in the town of Mammoth, in western Pennsylvania. In those days, Electro-Glass produced small quantities of preforms using three standard glasses. Today, we enjoy a world-wide reputation in the glass preform industry.

Today, Electro-Glass continues to strive to be a leader in the 21st Century advancement of glass technology, making available to our customers the latest in new materials and fabricating techniques.

To learn more, visit our About page, or call us at 724-423-5000.

Quality Enclosures provides the highest quality shower enclosures and tempered glass

Consisting of multiple tempering and manufacturing facilities, Quality Enclosures is a company devoted to growth across its market, its employees and the communities it services.

Shower Door Products Luxury Products
Family Owned and Operated Since 1963
ABOUT
Quality Enclosures has a long history of family traditions and values

Quality Enclosures, Inc. was founded in 1963 by Manny Schwartz based on family traditions and values. These attributes contribute to our long-standing reputation as a respected leader in the shower door industry.

We manufacture and fabricate a complete line of shower and tub enclosures using superior workmanship and the highest quality materials.

Whenever we produce a shower door or enclosure, we treat it – from the very beginning of the process to the very end – as if it was going into our own home. Today we are proud to say we are still family-owned and operated in the U.S.A.

 
OUR PRODUCTS
Glass tempering, enclosure manufacturing and production, and powder-coating
Glass Enclosures & Protection

Quality Enclosures has a long history of producing the best glass shower enclosures in the industry, as well as providing glass for protective barriers, commercial projects, and custom installation projects.


Hardware and Accessories

Engineered to our exact specifications and tolerances, Quality Enclosures offers our own branded hardware for use in nearly limitless applications of shower doors.


Construction Industries

Quality Enclosures has the capacity to handle large-scale and multi-family projects in a timely fashion without sacrificing quality or accuracy.

Colors and Options

Whether it's a powder-coated color or specialty hardware, Quality Enclosures has the means and resources to accommodate thousands of types of custom requests.

FABRICATED MICROCAPILLARY GLASS TUBING AND FUSED QUARTZ DRAWING

At Friedrich & Dimmock, Inc., we we take pride in fabricating micro capillary glass tubing and fused quartz drawing with unparalleled precision and accuracy of both inner and outer diameters. To ensure the highest level of quality, we employ laser-controlled processes, guaranteeing submicron accuracy in every aspect. Additionally, our extensive range includes a variety of specialty shapes and sizes, catering to the diverse needs of our valued clients. With our expertise in glass fabrication, you can trust us to deliver the perfect solution for your industry, science, and optics requirements.

MANUFACTURED PRECISION BORE GLASS TUBING

We take pride in our expertise in manufacturing precision bore glass tubing, offering a wide selection of materials including borosilicate glass, fused quartz, or specialty glass, giving you the freedom to choose what best suits your needs. Each glass tube is meticulously crafted to precise lengths and can be finished using a variety of methods such as grinding, polishing, sealing, chamfering, sandblasting, cerium lapping, or other customizable options. The result is a clean, chip-free glass tube that is ready to be used in your specific applications. With our commitment to quality and attention to detail, you can rely on us for top-notch manufactured glass tubing that meets the highest standards in the industry.

FABRICATED “ONE OFF” DESIGN OR HIGH VOLUME

F&D caters to your unique needs with our flexible glass fabrication services, offering both “one off” designs and high-volume production capabilities. Our team of experts excels in providing custom-engineered solutions that are tailored to your specific requirements. With a focus on delivering cost-effective and innovative designs, we ensure that your projects are met with the utmost efficiency and creativity. Whether you need a single, specialized piece or require a large batch of custom glass products, we have the expertise and resources to meet your demands with precision and excellence. Trust us to bring your ideas to life with our top-of-the-line glass fabrication services.

A Little of Our History:

General Signals was started in 1950 and the company was operated from the owner’s garage until 1985 when he sold the company to the present owners. His only products were a limited number of railroad lenses. The company has expanded to include every signal lens used in this industry, the Gate Keeper, the electronic bell, LED crossing lights, gate lights, gate arms, and Crossbucks.

The Gate Keeper was introduced to the industry in 1990 and has literally saved the industry millions of dollars by reducing the replacement of broken gates. The electronic crossing bell has no moving parts; its non-corrosive construction has saved the industry considerable costs also. We consider both products to be the most superior Gate Keeper and electronic bell available.

We keep all of our products at adequate inventory levels to supply your needs almost immediately. Your order placed with us today may be shipped to you tomorrow and certainly within a week.

Don’t hesitate to contact us for additional information about these products, pricing and delivery.

PRODUCTS

Innovative Products, Quality Design...No Exceptions.

To be the best, you have to build the best.

Stampede Fiberglass Products has developed and maintains a Quality Management System (QMS) along with a Quality Management System Manual (QMSM).

​

Inspection begins at the very start of fabrication as raw materials are checked and inventory is properly stored and allocated.  During the fabrication process, a series of In-Process Inspections take place. We also test the cure of each tank shell with a Barcol Hardness Test. Prior to certification for shipping, each tank undergoes a hydrostatic test to check for any leaks. No tank leaves our facility if it has not met our quality standards.​

 

Our Promise:

Stampede Fiberglass Products, LLC strives to produce quality fiberglass products with a goal of limiting and/or eliminating product defects and process errors; thus providing our customers with quality fiberglass products for use in their systems.

Simply the Best Window Wells.

Give your home an upgrade by transforming your basement into an inviting, livable space. We offer stunning, modern window wells that enhance the look of your home—inside and out.

FIND A DISTRIBUTOR

What Sets Our Window Wells Apart?
Natural Style

Say goodbye to window wells made of corrugated metal. Our products are designed to replicate the color and texture of real stone to add a little luxury to your basement.

Durability

Built from high-strength composites, our products are rust proof, temperature resistant and won’t collapse from backfill pressure. Invest in window wells that are designed to last.

Safety

Our egress window wells come with built-in steps that allow easy-escape access during emergencies. Ensure your family’s safety in any room of your basement.

Easy Installation

Cut the installation time down with light, one-piece window wells that can be mounted directly to your foundation wall.

10-year Limited Warranty

Get peace of mind knowing that your new window wells are covered by a ten-year limited warranty—including product repair and replacement at no charge.

LEDs represent the the newest frontier in lighting technology. Combining energy efficiency and a long lifespan, LED bulbs consume up to 90% less energy than equivalent incandescent bulbs, leading to a significant reduction in energy costs . Continued improvements in performance and reliability make LED bulbs the obvious choice for most lighting applications.

Krypton/Xenon

Krypton/Xenon lighting is common in sign and display lighting, as well as accent lighting. These bright, white lights have a high color rendering index and a longer life than standard incandescents and halogens. Krypton/Xenon bulbs also produce brighter, whiter light than standard incandescents, and Xenon lamps can typically be used in unshielded fixtures.

DETROIT SERIES

The story of Lumecon’s Detroit Series is heavily influenced by the cars and trucks Detroit has been producing for the past 100 years. The sleek lines of the design are reminiscent of the muscle cars and pick-ups giving the look a Motor City feel. The LDS offers a bold Detroit inspired design that performs efficiently and reliably against a rugged outdoor environment.

We are here for you

 

Founded in 2006, Lumecon is a proud manufacturer of high quality LED lighting that’s affordable, creative, and built to last. We continually support our local communities by sourcing from the brightest suppliers and creating meaningful relationships with those around us. These relationships allow us to innovate LED technology, grow our people, and provide world-class service which exceeds the expectations of our customers.

What to Expect From Your Free In-Home Estimate

Our initial consultation provides the information we need to give you the best price on windows you'll love for a lifetime.

1. Find The Right Style

Your Champion representative will walk you through our product options, custom styles and colors, and warranties. They'll also help you compare the value of our windows to other window providers.

2. Review Price & Financing

Together, we'll review current promotions, calculate your estimated monthly payment and energy bill savings, and determine the best financing options for your project.

3. Same Day Quote

You'll get an exact, no-obligation quote for both your new windows and installation, and we'll discuss next steps in the home transformation process.

Stay On Trend With Custom Specialty Mirrors

Plain, basic mirrors have not changed much from the ones commonly installed in the 1970s and before. People wanted practicality, and they got it. 

Today, everywhere you look online or on home improvement shows, you see modern bathrooms prominently include framed mirrors.

Why?.... Because they are essential to complete an upgraded, modern appearance. 

As a result, design-oriented homeowners, home builders, architects, and multi-family developers are requesting framed mirrors for their projects. And with over 150 framed mirror options, plus our customized solutions, your customers will be happy, 100% of the time.

 

Pictured: Classic Frame- 220BLK

Drive Your Sales By Giving Your Customers the Custom Mirrors They Want

Many companies are hesitant to provide their customers what they really want when it comes to offering custom framed mirrors. The reasons are many:

Long and unreliable lead times that can cause them to miss construction deadlines
The belief that a luxurious look comes with a luxurious price tag
Not wanting to buy from a competitor
The realization that doing it themselves is labor intensive and expensive
The local frame shop is not geared for new construction or remodeling

It doesn’t have to be that way.

At Precision Frameworks, we recognize these concerns. This is why we make it easy to offer your customers the customized mirrors they want. We are dedicated to serving businesses installing mirrors, specialty building products, after-paint building products, and Division 8 and Division 10 products.

Pictured: Value Series Frame- 241G

Lightning Fast Quote Turnaround

We understand that you’re busy and that time is money. This is why we strive to provide a quote within the same business day.

Ultra-Reliable Product Lead Times

Our extensive inventory and domestic product sourcing enable us to consistently ship on-time and complete.  Giving you the peace of mind you deserve.

Extensive Framed Mirror Options

Everyone has different tastes, wants, and budgets. This is why we offer over 150 framed mirror options— so you can satisfy nearly every customer's request.

At Precision Frameworks, we are the nation’s largest manufacturer of custom framed mirrors for new home constructions, multi-family developments, hospitality, and MRO industries. Our product lineup includes custom-sized framed mirrors, LED, oval, round, radius corner, and pivot mirrors. 

We believe in the importance of supporting our dealers in many ways, including:

Joint builder and architect sales calls
Marketing support — displays, literature, and samples
Sales and product knowledge training

We are grateful for our partnerships and market-leading dealers nationwide, and we work with you every step of the way to ensure that you can provide customized framed mirrors to your customers — on time and on budget.

Optical Fiber Brings Our World Together
Our fiber optics business line is operated through BizLink’s wholly-owned subsidiary, OptiWorks, founded in 2000, headquartered in Fremont, California in the U.S. Manufacturing and product development facilitiesare located in Kunshan, China, and are equipped with clean rooms and ESD protection environments for production. OptiWorks is ISO9001/TL9000 certified and is one of the leading global manufacturers of fiber optics components and integrated modules for various Telecommunication, Data Center and industrial applications.
40CH Ultra compact DWDM
40CH Ultra compact DWDM®
The 40-channel Ultra-Low Loss and Compact Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing (DWDM) system is built on the foundation of Thin-Film-Filter and Micro-Optics technologies. This cutting-edge product combined with the patented free-space DWDM portfolio from 4, 8, 16, and 20 channels is revolutionizing the telecommunications industry with its unparalleled efficiency and compact design, setting a new standard for high-performance optical networking.
LEARN MORE
Ultra Compact CWDM®
Ultra Compact CWDM®
Optiworks' ultra-compact CWDM is based on TFF platform. A series TFFs are attached to a metal base. Multiple wavelengths incident to the filters at certain angle with one band of wavelength pass through while all other bands of wavelength are reflected. To make it ultra-compact, folding mirrors are used and light path is zigzag form. The integrated optical and mechanical components are then quasi-hermetically packaged. The function of such CWDM device is to combine multiple wavelengths into single fiber or send different wavelengths to separate fiber. The device works uni- or bidirectional. Multiple fibers are coming out from the same side of device to make the fiber management easier.
LEARN MORE
Ultra Compact DWDM(100G-200G)®
Ultra Compact DWDM(100G-200G)®
Optiworks' ultra-compact DWDM is based on TFF platform. A series TFFs are attached to a glass or metal base. Multiple wavelengths incident to the filters at certain angle with one wavelength pass through while all other bands of wavelength are reflected. To make it ultra-compact, folding mirrors are used and light path is zigzag form. The integrated optical and mechanical components are then tightly packaged. The function of such DWDM device is to combine multiple wavelengths into single fiber or send different wavelengths to separate fibers. The device works uni- or bidirectional. Multiple fibers are coming out from the same side of device to make the fiber management easier.
LEARN MORE
Ultra Compact CWDM-DWDM Hybrid®
Ultra Compact CWDM-DWDM Hybrid®
Optiworks' ultra compact CWDM-DWDM is based on well-developed thin film filter (TFF) technology and use ultra-compact free-space micro-optic integration method. The device can work in a wide range of temperature and has extraordinarily performance, which could meet the industry standard requirements.
LEARN MORE

The James & James Story

What started with a single coffee table and a passion for quality hardwood furniture, quickly turned into the James & James you see today. We're proud to employ over 100 people in Springdale, Arkansas, hand-crafting every custom order that comes in.

Learn More
Made for Life

We say furniture has the power to transform a house into a home, but it’s not often we celebrate the diverse stories and connections it helps manifest beyond the mere functionality of the products themselves.

 We promise to craft the heart of your home with heritage-quality furniture and care that welcomes life's moments. Our furniture is more than wood, screws, and stain; it's the foundation for family memories, laughter and love. We commit to delivering pieces that withstand the test of time, both in craftsmanship and in the moments they host. 

Complimentary Design Service

Looking to customize even further or need help getting started? From recommending styles and finish colors to helping you customize beyond belief, our Design Team is ready to help.

Book Your Free Consultation
"Fast Furniture" is Out of Style

Would you believe most furniture is designed to last an average of 5 years? Poor quality, mass-produced Fast Furniture made overseas has reached an all-time high and is having dire consequences on the planet.

At James & James, we're flipping Fast Furniture on it's head. We're handcrafting solid wood, heirloom-quality furniture, designed to be passed down to future generations. Best of all – everything we sell is 100% Made in the USA.

Learn More About The James & James Difference

About Us



Tempco Glass Fabrication launched our modest 45,000-square-foot facility in the heart of Flushing, New York, with one focus: to leverage our decades of experience in the glass and fenestration industry to become the premier Glass Professionals' Choice for local glaziers, glass shops, and manufacturers -- no matter how big or small. Our goal has always been to be a company that remains laser-focused on our customers and our employees, and despite having doubled our employee count and manufacturing space in the last year alone, we have always maintained the personality of being a modest family-operated business. This gives us the ability to remain nimble and flexible enough to satisfy the needs of all of our customers, as no customer is ever considered "too demanding." Moreover, we have never shied away from making smart investments in state-of-the-art CNC and glass fabrication equipment to provide top-quality glass fabrication services to our customers, including cutting, notching, drilling, milling, and edging; and of course, let's not forget about our glass tempering furnace capable of providing SGCC-certified tempering services of thicknesses from 1/8" and up.


Our quality has been recognized by our customers and suppliers domestically and worldwide, and we are IGCC-certified to fabricate dual-sealed insulated glass units using a wide selection of high-performance low-e coatings proudly made in the USA, sourced from top float suppliers such as PPG, AGC, and Guardian. We also stock a variety of thicknesses of different glass types, including clear, tinted, low-iron (including Starphire), reflective, acid-etched, patterned, mirrored, laminated, and other high-performance MSVD and pyrolytic coatings.


At Tempco Glass, you're more than just a customer. You're a valued friend and partner. Please do not hesitate to contact our team at any time; better yet, stop by for a factory tour so that we can prove to you that you have a friend at Tempco Glass.

Certifications



MBE Certifications

Tempco Glass Fabrication has received certifications from the New York City Department and the Port Authority of New York & New Jersey of Small Business Services as a Minority Business Enterprise.

SGCC-certified

Tempco provides glass tempering furnace capable of providing Safety Glazing Certification Council (SGCC) certified tempering services of thicknesses from 1/8" and up.

IGCC-certified

Tempco is IGCC-certified to fabricate dual-sealed insulated glass units using a wide selection of high-performance low-e coatings proudly made in the USA, sourced from top float suppliers such as Vitro, AGC, Guardian, and Pilkington.

Vitro Authorized Supplier
Guardian Glass SunGuard Select Fabricator
AGC Certified Processor
IMPROVED LEAD TIMES

We’ve listened! You want your glass fast.
After adjusting shifts, optimizing truck routes, and making internal process improvements, we are now able to provide shorter lead times.

EARLY BIRD PICK-UP

We will now be opening our doors at 7:30AM for customer pick-ups so you can spend more time doing work and less time on the road. Please be sure that your order has been paid-in-full so you don’t have to deal with pesky paperwork.

FASTER TURN-AROUND ON QUOTES

Need a quote? Ask one of our sales reps for an order entry template, so we can import it directly into our system to eliminate key-in errors and provide faster turnaround on quotes and orders.

Tempco offers exemplary services for small and mid-size customers as well as large companies. Our experienced staff understands your business – we’re local, so turnaround is fast, from quote to finished product. With value pricing and our state-of-the-art production equipment and techniques, Tempco consistently provides its customers quality glass products.

Vertical Milling and Drilling

Our brand new state-of-the-art CNC Mill and Drill is capable of processing virtually any cut-out, regardless of complexity, using its multi-tool spindle for milling, drilling, countersinking, and arising. When coupled with our experienced technicians, we can process small and large-volume shower door orders, glass entrance door systems, display cases, and furniture set pieces.

Glass Cutting & Washing

Our new cutting table triples our current capacity. It cuts quicker than we can break. Precise cuts, every time. The fully automated CNC glass cutting table provides straight-edge and shape cutting, has edge deletion capability, and handles glass sheets up to 144" x 100". Our 8-brush glass washer and dryer system accommodates all glass types, including Low-E.

Edge Polishing & Mitering

Our vertical automated edge polishers accommodate large-size glass, rapid cycle times and considerable processing capacity. We offer flat polishing as well as mitered edges.

Notching & Drilling Holes

Our semi-automatic drilling equipment provides notches and holes up to 6 inches for all your installation needs, such as shower doors, glass railing, interior partitions and tabletops.

Insulated Glass Units

Aside from offering quick lead times, Tempco is IGCC-certified to fabricate virtually any unit thickness, size, and glass configuration, including high-performance argon-filled double or triple pane units requiring high-performance soft-coat Low-E coatings, ranging from PPG-Vitro Solarban 60 to AGC Energy Select.
We also stock a large selection of spacers, muntins, and SDLs in finishes. Our standard units utilize desiccant-filled aluminum spacers and are dual-sealed with a PIB primary seal and a structural silicone secondary seal.

Glass Tempering

Our full convection tempering furnace can handle glass sheets up to 82" x 128", and from thicknesses of 1/8" to 1/2".

Professional Delivery

Tempco offers delivery service to jobsite and trade customer locations. Scheduled routes include Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx, Long Island, Manhattan, Upstate New York, and New Jersey. We also accommodate special shipping requirements. Just speak to one of our customer service representatives for pricing and details.

Boom Truck Delivery

Tempco introduces a new boom truck that provides ability to boom boxed leads to jobsite and trade customer locations. Our shipping schedule system provides high-volume order on a single run, without backorders. Please contact one of our customer service representatives for pricing and details.

Tempco Glass Executive Recognized with Business Award
Oct 13,2022

Tempco Glass Fabrication top executive Johnson Chen was recently recognized by the Asian American Business Development Center (AABDC) at its annual 50 Outstanding Asian Americans in Business Awards event. This prestigious national award recognizes the Asian-American entrepreneurs and business leaders who have made significant contributions in corporate America, their communities, and the economy.


Tempco Glass Price Reduction May 2022
May 5,2022

Effective May 11, 2022, we will be reducing our pricing on the following glass types. 6mm clear glass: 15% drop for monolithic annealed and tempered. This will also reduce the cost of insulated glass units using 6 mm clear glass. 6mm SN68 Tempered: 10% decrease on tempered 6 mm SN68. This will reduce the cost of insulated glass units using this glass type.Several other glass types based on volume and as we continue to evaluate.


Tempco Glass Fabrication Receives New York City MBE Certification
Aug 17, 2020

Tempco Glass Fabrication, a regional glass processing firm headquartered in New York, has received certification from the New York City Department of Small Business Services as a Minority Business Enterprise (MBE).


Tempco on the Inc. 5000 List
Aug 12, 2020

Inc. magazine today revealed that TEMPCO GLASS is No. 4705 on its annual Inc. 5000 list, the most prestigious ranking of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies. The list represents a unique look at the most successful companies within the American economy’s most dynamic segment—its independent small businesses. Intuit, Zappos, Under Armour, Microsoft, Patagonia, and many other well-known names gained their first national exposure as honorees on the Inc. 5000.


Tempco Glass Fabrication Provides Clear Walkway View for Queens Museum Historic Exhibit
Mar 16, 2020

New York’s rising regional glass processing firm Tempco Glass Fabrication recently supplied over 200 tempered glass panels for the renovation of the historic Panorama of the City of New York’s glass walkway at the Queens Museum.
The Panorama is an architectural scale model of New York City, originally created for the 1964 World’s Fair. At almost 10,000 square feet, it is the largest architectural scale model in the world and is surrounded by an elevated visitor viewing walkway. Four sections of the perimeter walkway use glass floor panels, supported by a steel structure, to permit viewing of the model below.

Welcome to Mid-American Glass, Inc.

Since 1987, Mid-American Glass has worked to find smart solutions to the challenges facing our customers. Solutions based on quality products, expanded services, and industry experience. From the early stages of your project, MAG gives you one resource for product information, estimating, fabrication, and on time delivery.

Our vision at MAG is to provide the products you need, the quality you expect, the selection you require, and the service you deserve. We give you a dedicated team, dynamic, responsive, motivated, with accountable individuals … accountable to you. Working together, delivering you more.

Have questions about a specific product? Just click on the link (located on the left-side toolbar) to its individual product page. If the information there doesn't answer your question, visit our suppliers' websites via our related links page, or contact us with your question.

Want to know what MAG has been up to? Check out our news and project gallery pages. Never done business with MAG before? Look over our about us and main products page to learn about who we are and what we do. This website is just another way we're working to serve you better.

SUN-TEK CATALOG




Sun-Tek Skylights is one of the leading skylight manufacturers in the United States. For over 30 years we have provided an affordable, easy way to let the sun shine into your home.

Sun-Tek has been providing the home building industry with quality natural lighting products and accessories for over thirty years. A privately owned American corporation, Sun-Tek offers its customers – service before, during and after the sale. We provide all needed support to achieve the customers stated goals for total satisfaction.

Our headquarters and factory are located in the heart of Central Florida, where we are famous for both our year round sunshine and our annual hurricane season.

So it should come as no surprise that Sun-Tek Skylights are designed and manufactured to withstand whatever punishment the sun, wind and rain can deliver. Call us today and Let the Sunshine In!

About Faour Glass Technologies

Faour Glass Technologies is unique in every way. Our glass systems, engineering, installation, and customer service reflects the pride we take in every job we do. If you want to make a statement in glass, we are the company for you. Since 1975, we have been an innovator in creating stunning, high-performance residential and commercial glass systems, including stairs, floors, walls, railings, overhead glazing, and doors. We offer our customers complete integration from design and engineering to fabrication and installation — providing some of the most imaginative glass solutions in the world.

SLIMPACT® Frameless Impact Glazing Solutions

Window Walls | Pivot & Automated Doors | Skylights | Railings

VIEW SLIMPACT GALLERY

SLIMPACT Frameless Glazing Solutions
SLIMPACT Frameless Impact Glazing Solutions is a portfolio of frameless impact products that includes Window Walls, Entry Glass Doors (Pivot & Automated), Exterior Capless Glass Railings, and Skylights. This patented line of hurricane impact windows and impact-resistant doors provides the perfect all-glass window and door solution for luxury residential homes, automotive dealerships, exclusive retailers, and commercial entrances. The SLIMPACT portfolio of products provides the perfect solution for the ultimate view with superior hurricane protection.

Sky-Frame Impact Sliding Glass Doors
Our collection of frameless impact products also includes Sky-Frame frameless impact sliding glass doors. The Sky-Frame door is one of the largest hurricane-rated sliding door systems in the world, meeting the High Velocity Hurricane Zone (HVHZ) standards, with design pressures up to 75 psf.

Designing with Frameless Impact Windows & Doors
Today, there are many choices for windows and doors with impact-resistant glass that meet the stringent large-missile hurricane codes. Hurricane rated windows and doors offer the protection required to live in Florida, the Caribbean, and other regions of the United States susceptible to high winds. SLIMPACT was introduced in 2015 and has changed the landscape of high-performance windows and doors, offering a frameless solution without sacrificing the performance required for impact windows and doors. To see the difference SLIMPACT can offer, view our extensive gallery of SLIMPACT projects. For technical support or to view details and test reports, visit our Design Tools page.

SLIMPACT Featured Project

SLIMPACT Windows for Luxury Residential Spaces

The Sanctuary at Alexandra Place is designed from the inside out to capture the feeling of the environment surrounding you, including views of the beautiful tree canopies of the lush Fred Ball Park adjacent to The Sanctuary.

SLIMPACT offers every homeowner an incredible view of Hillsborough Bay with no obstruction of metal framing. The Sanctuary’s homes are integrated into the environment, designed with a material selection of natural stone, wood, and stunning glass accents. Even though its technological function is state-of-the-art, The Sanctuary maintains a natural and holistic environment.

Quality Craftsmanship


American artisan-crafted contemporary luminaires are modern marvels of engineering and design with unique elements, ranging from halo rings to atomic styled orbs. About Meyda Lighting

Features

Not just limited to one of a kind pieces, Meyda Custom Lighting provides scores of themes for various projects across a range of market segments. No project is too large or complex.

Design & Engineering

Work closely with our engineering team to verify installation specifications including weight restrictions, wattage and amp requirements, hardware, and assembly instructions. 

Custom Finishing

The crowning touch for any Meyda Lighting decorative piece is the finish, and when it comes to the finish, process is everything. Over the years, we have developed a myriad of meticulous finishing techniques. Additionally we’ve purchased state of the art application equipment and invested in technologies. 

Custom Sized Fixtures

Scalability is important in today’s changing marketplace. It’s important to work with manufacturers that can create statement pieces in nearly any size– from the massive grand styled chandeliers, to mid-sized ceiling mounts and wall sconces, to delicate mini pendants.

Mateenbar Advantages
	
	
	
	
The Mateenbar Advantage

Over 30 Years of Strength, Purpose, and Sustainable Innovation—Proudly Made in the USA. Discover Why Mateenbar® Reinforces What Matters Most.

Find Out More
For residential and light industrial projects.

Greenbar2X™ is an environmentally sustainable, high-performance GFRP fiberglass rebar designed to outperform steel in residential and light commercial applications. Its lightweight, rustproof design simplifies transport and installation without compromising on strength. Built to withstand all weather conditions, Greenbar2X™ reinforces the foundations of our everyday living—offering trust and maintenance-free durability for foundations, driveways, pool decks, and more. Ideal for flatwork projects and smaller vertical applications 10 feet or less.

Learn More About Greenbar2X
For structural and heavy industrial projects.

Mateenbar60™ is engineered for large-scale projects like bridges and multi-story buildings that demand high tensile strength and exceptional durability. Designed to reinforce larger structural applications, Mateenbar60™ is corrosion-free, chemical-resistant, and eco-friendly. It outperforms steel in all environments, delivering superior performance while reducing labor, fuel, and long-term maintenance costs.

Learn More About Mateenbar60
Key Advantages Over Steel Rebar
High Tensile Strength

Stronger and more dependable than steel for superior performance.

Lightweight

Lighter than steel for easier handling and faster installation.

Rustproof

Corrosion resistant for more long-lasting and durable structures.

Meets or Exceeds Standards

Complies with industry standards, codes and specifications.

See All Advantages
Greenbar2X Applications

Greenbar2X™, our flatwork fiberglass rebar, offers dependable strength, ease of use and long-lasting durability for your concrete reinforcement needs. Its lightweight design and durability factor make it the clear alternative to steel.

Learn more
Mateenbar60 Applications

Mateenbar60™, our structural fiberglass rebar, has been used for over 30 years to build key infrastructure projects worldwide, including the Harkers Island Bridge Replacement in North Carolina and the Jizan Flood Mitigation Channel in Saudi Arabia – the world’s largest GFRP project at over 14 miles in length.

Learn more
At Mateenbar, we build products and value trust. Our mission is to reinforce the structures that connect communities and shape the future. The 100-year lifespan and corrosion-free durability deliver smarter, safer, and more resilient solutions for infrastructure worldwide.
Steven Holmes| CEO, Mateenbar Composite Reinforcements, LLC

We produce strong and sustainable materials for everyday products
View Solutions Our Mission
Our fibers make your favorite objects more sustainable and efficient – like surfboards.
Consumer Materials
Sunstrand fibers can be used as a filler or reinforcement agent in many different thermoset and thermoplastic systems.
Sporting and Recreation Equipment
The high stiffness, damping properties and low weight of natural fibers make them ideal for sporting good applications.
Transportation
Huge opportunities for manufacturing automotive parts with natural fibers.
Building Materials
Natural fibers provide a sustainable alternative to many building materials.
Learn more about Sunstrand applications
From seed to fiber, our engineers and farming partners are advancing biomaterial innovation

Our engineers, scientists, and technicians are dedicated to furthering the usage of sustainable materials in new and innovative applications.

Learn More

We work closely with our farming community to procure the best materials. From seeds to harvest, we pay close attention so we always deliver consistent, high-quality products.

Learn More

Sunstrand Sustainability Promise

We work closely with our farming community to procure the best bio-materials including, hemp, kenaf, flax and bamboo. From seeds to harvest, we pay close attention so that we always deliver consistent, high-quality products, that are rapidly renewable and environmentally friendly. replacements for glass fibers.

Read more

Materials

Natural fibers are rapidly renewable and available alternative source of material for a wide range of applications.

Sunstrand fibers are compatible with thermoset and thermoplastic sheet and bulk molding compounds, as well as infusion processes. Our goal is to provide products that are drop-in replacements for glass fibers.

See materials
Products

Sunstrand’s core values of sustainablilty, performance, innovation, and social impact are evident in each and every one of our product lines. After thoughtful analysis into various industries and thanks to an innovative R&D department, we have designed our products with the goal of improving on already-existing goods.

See products
Services

Sunstrand is dedicated to providing tailored manufacturing solutions and other services to better meet the needs of our customers.

Custom blending, fiber dyeing, and product development are all services we can be challenged with.

See services
Supply Chain

No matter the industry Sunstrand is the future of sustainable manufacturing. From home construction to automobile fabrication to sporting goods equipment, you’ll find our fiber based products are a better alternative both for the environment, for durability and for cost.

See supply chain

9
	
WHY RF (RADIO FREQUENCY) SHIELDING?

Governments and Commercial organizations need secure locations to handle sensitive and/or classified information. Our patented Signals Defense RF/IR Shielding window films  transforms ordinary spaces into secure spaces. Including transforming Conference rooms, offices, and data centers into secure spaces that meet TEMPEST standards for protecting electronic equipment from digital theft, accidental data leaks, and espionage.

9
	
ABOUT US

Signals Defense is a privately held, company based in Owings Mills, MD, USA. We protect information and people by creating secure work environments.

SIGNALS DEFENSE – RF/IR SECURITY SOLUTIONS

Signals Defense sets the benchmark in RF/IR window films and shielding materials for Secure Work Environments, including SCIFs (Sensitive Compartmented Information Facilities). Safeguarding your assets and privacy by utilizing Signals Defense RF and IR window shielding technology ensures the protection of data stored, presented, and discussed within conference rooms or entire buildings.

 

Signals Defense, LLC was founded in Owings Mills, MD in 1999.  Our company began with the introduction of an innovative optically clear window film technology that provides high RF (Radio Frequency) and IR (Infrared) attenuation for RF Shielding, RF protection, and Thermal Imaging defense purposes.  Additionally, our Signals Defense patented window technology is engineered to meet stringent US Intelligence Community security requirements for facilities handling classified information.

SD technology is the de facto written standard for the US Government and for organizations desiring to properly secure locations handling sensitive and/or classified information, and our window films meet the TEMPEST requirement for the Intelligence Community Directive ICD 705 and the DoD Infrared and Radio Frequency Emanation Protection Standards. Furthermore, our SD technology has been deployed on over 3000+ locations providing our clients (including Government Intelligence agencies, DoD, and Fortune 100 companies) with US DoD emission security systems. Lastly, Signals Defense technology provides safety and energy benefits with UV and glass fragmentation/spall control and our technology can be laminated within glass, and polycarbonates.

RF WINDOW FILM FOR ENHANCED SCIF SECURITY

 Signals Defense  films meet the DOD standards for blocking RF and IR interference in SCIFs, offices, and facilities that handle confidential information.

 Our patented RF/IR shielding films and products help transform ordinary conference rooms, offices, and data centers into secure spaces that meet TEMPEST standards for protecting electronic equipment from digital theft, accidental data leaks, and espionage.

The US Government and commercial organizations that need secure handling of sensitive and/or classified information; choose Signals Defense.

ABOUT OUR RF AND IR SHIELDING FILMS
OUR PARTNERS

Signals Defense partners with leading security and film companies across the globe:

EASTMAN CHEMICAL COMPANY

Founded in 1920, Eastman is a global advanced materials and specialty additives company that produces a broad range of products found in items people use every day. Eastman is a leading manufacturer and marketer of high-performance window tint and paint protection film for automotive applications, window film for residential and commercial applications and the co-developer of the RF/IR attenuating “SD” window film products with Signals Defense. As a globally inclusive and diverse company, Eastman employs approximately 14,500 people around the world and serves customers in more than 100 countries. The company had 2019 revenues of approximately $9.3 billion and is headquartered in Kingsport, Tennessee, USA. For more information, visit  www.eastman.com.

 
COVERTECH FABRICATING, INC

Covertech manufactures rFoil Ultra NT Radiant Barrier Foils and tapes for SCIFs (Sensitive Compartmented Information Facilities) construction.  These highly effective radiant barrier products are also an approved vapor barrier.  Since 2016, Signals Defense has been a nationwide distributor of Covertech RF foils and tapes. Visit Covertech/rFoil 

AIT


The AIT Group is a world leader in manufacturing and supporting architectural, security, ballistic, blast, impact, and decorative glass laminates, among other innovative materials.  They specialize in producing advanced combinations of materials and processing them to meet design and security needs for a variety of applications. Visit AIT



RF DEFENSE

RF Defense has experienced technicians that have over 20 years experience, and hundreds of facilities and products tested utilizing a unique approach to Shielding Effectiveness Testing. If you require Instrumented testing whether it is RF or STC, no one can beat RF Defense in practice and knowledge. Visit RFDefense today to schedule testing.

 

FARADAY STRUCTURES

Faraday Structures protects critical infrastructure and professional environments from natural and man-made electromagnetic events, cyber intrusion, data theft, and any other wireless vulnerability. Faraday Structures technologies enable a unique approach to shielding fixed facilities and mobile shelters. Using proprietary and patented products, processes, and techniques, Faraday Structures provides cost effective solutions for a broad range of customers; protecting information, communications, and critical infrastructure secure by physically denying electromagnetic effects and wireless access.  Signals Defense is a distributor of Faraday Structures signature products:  EmCoat Conductive Paint, EmShield Conductive Wallpaper, EmCaulk Conductive Caulk,  and EmCaulk Flex Conductive Caulk.

Message from the Founder

I'm Dr. Nishikant Sonwalkar, Founder and CEO of AdaptiveWaves. Our company is on a mission to revolutionize the world of quantum optics and its applications, spanning from electronics to environmental solutions.

At AdaptiveWaves, we are passionate about harnessing the power of quantum confinement resonant cavities and combining them with plasmonics and photonics technologies. Our goal is to collaborate with you to pioneer new inventions and innovations that leverage these cutting-edge advancements.

We believe in the transformative potential of waves, energy, and frequency. With these elements at our disposal, we are poised to make significant strides across various technological domains, ultimately benefitting both communities and Humanity as a whole.

Join us in this exciting journey as we embark on a new venture called AdaptiveWaves. Together, let's explore the limitless possibilities of wave-based technologies and create a brighter future for all.

Introducing SpectraCoat™ Studio

Revolutionize your optical engineering projects with our cutting-edge photonic simulation platform. Designed for professionals and enthusiasts alike, it empowers you to create and optimize multilayer optical coatings with precision.

From long-pass and short-pass filters to advanced multilayer designs, our platform streamlines your workflow and elevates your results, making it the ultimate solution for superior optical component performance.

Our History & Services

For over 65 years Glass & Sash Inc. has specialized in all aspects of commercial and residential glass & glazing in Northern California. We maintain our outstanding level of workmanship and expertise starting from the design stage, through fabrication and installation. We provide a number of products ranging from exterior storefronts, curtain walls, entrance doors, door hardware, interior glass & glazing, glass and metal railings, metal awnings & canopies, mirrors, skylights, and solarium systems. We partner with and service most major brand windows, including the latest green energy efficient products.

Our high quality line of products, backed with the highest level of professional workmanship, and reliable service has earned us a respectable reputation among designers, architects, and general contractors. Since our establishment in 1958, we have striven to continue improving our commitment to quality and service. We consider this the foundation towards building long term mutually beneficial working relationships with our clients and partners.

Winandy Greenhouse Company

Winandy Greenhouse Company, Inc. has devoted itself to the design, manufacture, and installation of greenhouses since 1919. For more than 75 years, we have provided the highest quality and most reliable greenhouses to a variety of customers, both large and small. Specializing in institutional, governmental, commercial, retail/garden center, and estate/large residential greenhouses, Winandy works from concept specifications, design/build, or retrofit requirements, to handle your individual project, no matter the size. We offer complete greenhouses, including all normal greenhouse accessories such as doors, ventilation, heat systems, environmental control equipment, benching, irrigation and misting, motorized shade systems, heat retention, blackout curtain systems, exterior roll down aluminum shades, as well as all other greenhouse goods and systems.

Winandy's ability to succeed is based on a solid pledge to its founding values of integrity, teamwork and commitment to the customer. The company has a powerful resource of staff experience with years of proven industry expertise in costing, planning, building and delivery of projects that is unmatched in the industry.

INNOVATIVE BUILDING PRODUCTS, IBP, IS AN ACME BRICK COMPANY. AND FOR ACME, BRICK IS ONLY THE BEGINNING. 

When Acme Brick was founded in 1891, it was customary for homes and buildings to be clad in a single type of material - wood, stone or, yes, Acme Brick. Buildings today may have as many as five different types of cladding. 

So as always, Acme Brick is responding to the changing needs and preferences of our customers, though our Innovative Building Products division.

WORLD CLASS CLADDING SOLUTIONS
Thin brick – 9 different lines including our own thinBRIK series
Natural stone – including Acme’s exclusive Stonebrook line and the CUPACLAD wall system paired with natural slate
Premier metal cladding from MAC Metal Architectural, and Quality Edge
Ceramic and terracotta cladding systems – Agrob Buchtal
Advanced high-pressure laminate panels, such as Pura NFC by Trespa
High-density fiber cement from KØL USA
Panel-based fastening systems, including our patented Fast Track System
DuPont™ ArmorWall™ System - a 5-in-1 exterior wall assembly
TECHNICAL GUIDANCE, SUPERIOR SERVICE

A support team based at our Fort Worth headquarters stands ready to help: with design tips, shop drawings, and comprehensive technical assistance for every Acme and IBP product. Be sure to ask your local Acme representative which products are available to you.

Even as our product offerings expand, our mission remains the same: to fire imagination and to furnish the materials needed to execute any design. 

For more Acme Brick products, click here to visit us at brick.com.

IBP BLOG - RECENT NEWS
GROUNDBREAKING COMMERCIAL BUILDING PRODUCT ANNOUNCED – THE DUPONT™ ARMORWALL™ SYSTEM

 

WANT A COMPETITIVE EDGE? PUT YOUR PROJECT ON THE FAST TRACK


Marketing lore is replete with brand names that were so popular they became generic terms. Brands like Kleenex (facial tissue), Coke (soft drinks), Frigidaire (refrigerators) all benefited from this brand recognition in the marketplace. Interestingly, this process also works in reverse, where a generic term can become a popular brand. Want an example?

HYTECT – ENHANCED CERAMIC FACADES: USING THE POWER OF NATURE TO PROTECT COMMERCIAL BUILDINGS

Lead image: Self-cleaning and aesthetic Raiffeisen Forum, Mödling, Austria /Architects: X42 Team, Vienna, Austria / Photos: Rich Hiebl 


AN ANCIENT BUILDING MATERIAL WITH MODERN, BIOPHILIC BENEFITS: TERRACOTTA CLADDING

Photo credit (left to right): David Brossard, CC BY-SA 2.0 via Wikimedia Commons, Joe Mabel, CC BY-SA 3.0 via Wikimedia Commons, davidvives90/Pixabay,

HOW “PASSIVE HOUSE” CONSTRUCTION SAVES ENERGY


Physicists Bo Adamson from Lund University in Sweden and Wolfgang Feist from the Institut für Wohnen und Umwelt in Germany had read the research, dating back to the 1970s, that suggested it was possible to construct a low-energy building that was designed to exploit passive solar technologies and establish a comfortable indoor temperature with a low-energy requirement for heating or cooling. In 1988 the two professors coined a German term to describe this process. It was “Passivhaus.” 
 

BUILDING OWNERS DISCOVER THE ADVANTAGES OF NATURAL SLATE: ONE OF THE BEST IS CUPACLAD


While architects and contractors have recognized the benefits of rainscreen cladding for energy conservation for many years, savvy building owners are now asking about this product because it looks so great. In response, Acme Brick has added a premier rainscreen cladding line to its suite of products.


ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE AND CONSTRUCTION: HOW ARCHITECTS AND BUILDERS ARE HARNESSING THIS AMAZING TECHNOLOGY

 

HOW A “JOB” BECAME A CAREER: ED WATSON’S 40 YEARS WITH ACME BRICK COMPANY

THE SPECTACULAR LOOK OF STONE WITH EASY INSTALLATION: CORONADO STONE

Many home buyers love the natural look of stone but wince a little at the cost of this classic building material. This has led to an increase in the popularity of stone veneer, and one of the best is Coronado Stone, available from Acme Brick.

Coronado architectural stone veneer can be used to greatly enhance the look and feel of a wide range of projects, from exterior walls to interior accent walls, kitchen backsplashes to outdoor entertainment spaces, and any other spot that can benefit from the timeless character of stone.


AS MORTGAGE RATES LEVEL OFF, HOMEBUYERS ARE GIVING SUSTAINABILITY ANOTHER LOOK


There was a time in the not-so-distant past when the word “sustainability” almost never came up in conversations between potential home buyers and their builders. We live in a different world now. 
 
Consumer surveys have shown renewed interest on the part of home buyers in sustainability. Why? A sustainable home respects not only the planet but also the homeowner’s pocketbook. Here’s a checklist for discussing sustainability with your clients. 

NEW HOME BUYERS WANT SAFETY AND LOW MAINTENANCE: BRICK CONSTRUCTION HAS BOTH


Residential and commercial builders have first-hand experience with the durability, low maintenance, and safety of brick construction. Plus, the consensus among fire fighters is that a home or commercial building constructed of brick retards fire better than any other material. Even in the most destructive fires, the lives of residents and the people who must fight these fires can be saved, and the damage to the building can often be mitigated.
 

WHAT’S THE SECRET SAUCE FOR BUILDERS AND INVESTORS OF RESIDENTIAL RENTAL PROPERTIES? DURABLE CONSTRUCTION.

Many of those FOR SALE signs that were once everywhere in suburban neighborhoods have been replaced by signs offering the property FOR RENT. Whether homes are in recently completed communities or more mature neighborhoods, homes that are built to be rental properties are on the radar screens of builders and investors.  
 
This presents both challenges and opportunities for homebuilders.
 

MULTIPLE GENERATIONS LIVING UNDER ONE ROOF: HOW HOMEBUILDERS ARE ADJUSTING


According to census data, there were 6 million multigenerational households in the U.S. in 2020, up from 5.1 million in 2010. These are households that include two or more adult generations, or grandparents and grandchildren younger than 25. While many cultures and ethnic groups (e.g., Hispanic, Asian) have always embraced this extended family living arrangement, they are now being joined by all other groups.
 
Based on this trend, homebuilders are taking a closer look at offering floor plans that allow for greater flexibility.

WHY YOUR CLIENTS ARE ASKING FOR A “HEALTHY HOME”- ANTIBACTERIAL TILE CAN HELP

 

DIGITAL TOOLS FOR ARCHITECTS AND BUILDERS FROM ACME BRICK


With so many new products being added to Acme Brick’s inventory, architects and builders needed a convenient way to access their specifications, colors, and styles. Digital product brochures, catalogs, case studies, and other building and design resources have now been added to the site, dramatically increasing the accessibility of all product offerings. 
 

YOUR CLIENTS WANT TO ENTERTAIN OUTSIDE EVEN WHEN IT’S CHILLY. KEEP THEM COZY WITH A PATIO HEATER


Outdoor entertaining has never been hotter, even when it turns colder.
 
Fresh air with a few friends and family is certainly conducive to a great time, and nothing tastes better than grilled meat and vegetables. However, what about those times in the fall and winter when “baby, it’s cold outside?” 
 

ACME BRICK: YOUR SOURCE FOR STUNNING WROUGHT IRON DOORS


Since ancient times, wrought iron has been a popular addition to homes and public buildings. When this metal is used for doors, the designs and colors of this material make a design statement that suggests richness and timelessness. For builders who want to add an elegant component to brick construction, wrought iron is an excellent choice.

JOHN BREWER IS THE NEW GENERAL SALES MANAGER FOR ACME BRICK IN TEXAS


Builders who specify Acme Brick have another ally at the company in the new General Sales Manager for Texas. It’s John Brewer, a man who started his career as a residential home builder. Acme announced this promotion recently, and Brewer joins a long list of talented construction experts to hold this position in the company's more than 130 year history.
 

 , 
THE 5 WAYS MAC METAL SIDING TURNED DISASTER INTO DAZZLING FOR THE EXTERIOR OF A TEXAS OFFICE BUILDING


When they designed the ENT building in Fort Worth, Texas, the architects from the highly regarded firm of 97w did what great designers do: They spent weeks researching construction materials for the exterior facade of the building with the idea that it would make it stand out among the other buildings in the rapidly growing Clearfork area.

HOUSTON’S GULF BUILDING CONSTRUCTED IN 1927 OF ACME BRICK: STANDING THE TEST OF TIME


One of the most magnificent examples of commercial buildings designed in the “Art Deco” style was constructed of brick manufactured by Acme Brick. The Gulf Building is still a “show stopper” almost 100 years after it was built.
 

WHY YOUR CLIENTS MIGHT BE ASKING FOR SUSTAINABLE BUILDING PRODUCTS


As with many trends in residential construction, the term “sustainability” has gone from a buzzword used by a small number of people to the mainstream of new homebuyers. Why? One word: economics.
 

CLIENTS WANT TO BUILD A VACATION HOME, BUT IT’S LOCATED IN A HURRICANE ZONE

When clients find a lovely piece of coastal property and decide they want to build a vacation home, a red flag often goes up for builders. To be specific, two red flags with a black square in the middle of each is the warning for a hurricane! 
 

AFTER MORE THAN 130 YEARS, THE COMPANY BUILT WITH BRICK IS STRONGER THAN EVER


On April 17, 1891, businessman George E. Bennett chartered a company known as the Acme Pressed Brick Company. But not even a visionary like Bennet could image what was to come. By the mid-20th century, his company --- since renamed Acme Brick --- would become the largest American-owned brick manufacturer.

FOR RESIDENTIAL OR COMMERCIAL BUILDINGS: 5 REASONS TO PICK MAC METAL ARCHITECTURAL SIDING


Whether it's the heat of the blazing sun in the Southwest or the humidity and moisture in the Southeast, weather can wreak havoc on the exterior of any building — residential or commercial. This is why architects across the United States are rethinking their old decisions about cladding and choosing MAC Metal Architectural Siding.
 

A HOMEBUILDER CHECKLIST: 10 PREMIUM PRODUCTS YOUR CLIENTS WILL LOVE

 

ART DECO IS HOT AGAIN AND SO IS GLASS BRICK

 Art Deco, a design trend that first gained popularity in the 1920s, has regained popularity, and we’ve noticed that our customers, who are architects, builders, and interior designers, are thinking outside the glass box. Glass block and brick are hot again, and this trend is being driven by the consumer’s appreciation of the natural radiance of light.

HOW THINBRIK CAN REVITALIZE THE LOFT LOOK

The “loft look” got its start when manufacturers moved their operations from urban city centers to less expensive suburban areas starting in the 1950s. This left warehouse space available for redevelopment into living and working spaces for artists, writers, and other knowledge workers who loved the large rooms, exposed brick, low rent, and high-energy lifestyle these spaces provided.


FAST-MOVING RESIDENTIAL FIRES ARE OFTEN FED BY VINYL SIDING— HERE ARE 2 PRODUCTS TO HELP STOP THIS

In the past 50 years, the economics of home construction have changed dramatically. When vinyl siding and synthetic insulation materials were introduced in the 1960s, as a substitute for traditional brick and wood, home builders found their costs were reduced dramatically. In recent years, it is estimated by trade associations that homes wrapped in vinyl siding and synthetic insulation are purchased by 33 percent of new home buyers.

Storm Windows by Lang Exterior

Did you know the first product offered by Lang Exterior in 1953 was not replacement windows but aluminum storm windows?

Offering extra protection from the elements and increased energy efficiency, the Lang Exterior Barrier Storm Window line continues today and features modern aluminum construction.

An extruded aluminum frame and all metal parts make a stronger, sturdier storm window. Plus, one of the best features of these storm windows is the easy drop-in glazing...

"The elements are no match for the Barrier Storm Window." Click here to find out more!

V-Groove Window Glass

Did you know Lang offers V-Groove decorative etched window glass?

V-Groove glass is a decorative V-shape carved into the glass of your windows in a pattern of your choosing. Many patterns are available, including curved shapes. V-Groove window glass also creates a beautiful prism effect in sunlight. Lang Exterior V-Groove window glass is beautiful and maintenance free, just like our between-the-glass regular grids.

WELCOME TO INTERMOUNTAIN
WEST INSULATION!

Intermountain West Insulation stands as your premier choice for insulation, serving eastern Washington, Idaho, and Oregon. With a focus on builders, homeowners, and commercial clients, we offer comprehensive insulation solutions, including spray foam, blown-in, cellulose, and more, to ensure energy efficiency and comfort. Beyond insulation, we provide installations for garage doors and other building products. Our dedication to quality, extensive service range, and community commitment make us a trusted partner for all your insulation needs.

THE INTERMOUNTAIN WEST INSULATION DIFFERENCE
WHAT WE DO

We deliver precision and satisfaction across new residential, commercial, and builder projects. Specializing in a wide array of insulation types and comprehensive services, including attic to crawl space insulation, we ensure your property’s optimal energy efficiency. We also offer installations for garage doors and a suite of other building products, embracing a holistic approach to property enhancement.

WHAT WE STAND FOR

We’re committed to delivering the best products and services, with the most skilled team for every project. Understanding your needs and concerns is at the heart of what we do, ensuring every project is complete with total satisfaction. We're here to ensure you have the information and confidence you need. We're more than just an insulation company; we're your dedicated partner in creating comfortable and efficient spaces.

OUR COMMUNITY

Since 1981, Intermountain West Insulation has expanded its service area across eastern Washington, Idaho and Oregon. We proudly serve communities within a 150-mile radius of one of our strategic hubs in Wenatchee, Yakima, Spokane, or Kennewick. Our community commitment extends beyond our projects and services, as we actively support the communities where we operate through various initiatives and events.
