Why Select Burgess Snyder
From Idea to Installation
Our goal is to be involved with our customers each step of the way. From the very beginning of a project's development we help our clients pair the right product to each application. Once the project starts, we manage the process from shop drawings through procurement and finally installation which ultimately keeps projects within budget and on time.

Technologically Driven
At Burgess Snyder we are constantly looking for ways to improve our processes with the goal of increased efficiency without sacrificing quality. Our field superintendents carry tablets for note taking and cloud-based document reference. We have invested in a RhinoFab 900 system to streamline the storefront and curtain wall fabrication process. Our office maintains close to a 90% paper free environment. All of these investments have allowed us to focus more on the project and less on the paper.
Low Financial Risk
We have been in business for over 70 years and have developed strong relationships with our bank, bonding company, and insurance companies. Because we pay promptly, our suppliers give our projects their full attention and are very responsive to our requests. We have proven that we have what it takes to handle the financial responsibility to all parties involved with the projects we undertake.
About Burgess Snyder

Ownership history:

Burgess Snyder Industries began in 1948 when Jesse Burgess and Gustav Snyder formed Burgess Snyder Window Company. The new company sold storm windows and awnings from a small rented office in Norfolk, VA. In 1951 Jesse Burgess left the company but the business was established by then so the name remained the same. Gus Snyder died in 1969 and in 1971 Larry Vaughan bought the company from Mr. Snyder’s estate, keeping the Burgess Snyder name. In 1972, the company name was changed to Burgess Snyder Industries to better reflect the diverse range of products and services the company offered. In 1977, the company moved operations to it’s current facility located on Baker Road in Virginia Beach, VA. By 1993, Larry Vaughan had transferred ownership to his children, Tom Vaughan and Linda Sawyer. Tom Vaughan, Tom Johnson and Linda Sawyer owned and worked in the organization for better than 30 years each and witnessed tremendous growth during that time. In 2011, ownership was transferred to the current, third geration team of Chris Johnson, Kelly Kesler and Randall Vaughan.

Operations history:

Burgess Snyder formed initially as a manufacturer and installer of residential storm windows, storm doors and awnings. Manufacturing operations were carried out in a facility on Ballentine Blvd. in Norfolk, VA. In 1977, the company moved to the current location on Baker Road in Virginia Beach, VA. Soon after the move, the decision was made to stop manufacturing products in-house and instead sell pre-manufactured products from a select group of vendors. This decision allowed Burgess Snyder to focus more on customer service and develop quality installation crews.

Once manufacturing was phased out, the company primarily focused on providing replacement windows, doors, storm product and patio enclosures to the residential market. Since Norfolk is home to the world’s largest Navy base, it wasn’t long before Burgess Snyder was called on to provide services on commercial projects – specifically buildings at the various local government and military facilities. Two departments within the company were established to service each segment of the market since the residential and commercial customers have very different needs. Within the commercial department, an estimating and drafting team was created so all bids, shop drawings and submittals could be controlled in house. The commercial side of the business continued to grow allowing Burgess Snyder the resources and skills to complete larger and more complex projects. By the late 1980’s, the commercial department became the driving force of the company. For more than 20 years, Burgess Snyder Industries operated both the residential and commercial departments, each having their own management, office and installation teams but the market changed and so in 2007 the residential side of the operation was closed. Now, Burgess Snyder has 100% of it’s resources focused on commercial projects and provides sales and installation of the following architectural products for new construction and retrofit:

architectural aluminum windows
aluminum storefront
aluminum curtain wall
aluminum entrances
translucent panels
mirrors
skylights
architectural sunshades
glass canopies
aluminum canopies
glass entrances
blast windows, storefront and curtain wall
hurricane impact windows, storefront and curtain wall

ABOUT GILLINDER GLASS

Established in 1861, Gillinder Glass (Gillinder Brothers, Inc.) is a custom technical molded and filter glass manufacturer located in Port Jervis, NY. Gillinder specializes in pressed and custom molded, clear and colored glass products “Made in the USA” from both open (Gillinder-owned) and private (customer-owned) molds.

Gillinder is a world leader in the manufacture of optical filter glass. Current products include PAR lenses, convex covers, Fresnel lenses, vapor tight and explosion-resistant globes, domes, cylinders, industrial globes, sight lenses, NVIS-compatible filters and contoured covers. Custom shapes can also be engineered and produced.
 

 Established in 1861

Trusted Source for Glass Development Projects

50% Marketshare of Airfield Lighting Glass in the USA

Open Mold Catalog

In addition to producing as much as 50% of the glass components for airfield runway lights for the US market, Gillinder provides products for lighting and other applications for many industry segments (both domestic and international) including aerospace and defense, architectural, commercial, industrial, landscape, theatrical, and transportation.

Our chemists and engineers work with customers to assist in the design and development of custom glass products. Using multiple day tanks and pots, as opposed to continuous flow manufacturing techniques, Gillinder is able to produce multiple product shapes of different colors each day to meet each customer’s specific requirements. But, perhaps even more importantly, it allows us to serve a customer’s needs throughout their products' life cycle from limited introductory quantities, to full maturity production runs, and then heritage volumes.

Gillinder is proud of its rich heritage as a US glass manufacturer and its long standing (in some cases decades old) relationships with its customers. We look forward to continuing and building upon our reputation as a world leading manufacturer of technical molded glass products. If you are already a customer, thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you again. If you are not yet a customer, please contact us today so we may begin to provide the solution to your glass needs.

On the safe side
Since 1980, Vetrotech Saint-Gobain has been a pioneer and global leader in the development, manufacture, and distribution of innovative and reliable fire-rated and high-security glazed solutions.
Learn more
Your preferred partner for fire-rated and high-security glass solutions

Our wide range of fire-rated and bullet, blast, and impact-resistant glass provides architects, consultants, and trade partners with fully compliant and easily customisable solutions. We bring our safety and security expertise to every building project to ensure the delivery of safe, comfortable, and sustainable construction.

Discover how our range of fire-resistant and high-security glass solutions shape great spaces.

Fire-rated solutions

Our fire-rated glazing solutions keep people safe and buildings secure.

See our solutions
High-security solutions

Protecting people and property is our mission. Our range of high-security glass enables customers and partners to join us in making this world a safer place.

See our solutions
Customised solutions

Add more features to our glazing solutions to make your ideas a reality. Vetrotech supports you in design-assisting your projects according to your request.

Why partner with us
Reliability & expertise

We bring more than 40 years of experience in developing high-performing, multifunctional glass to work in advising you on the best systems and custom solutions to suit any application or risk scenario

Customised solutions

Whatever the architectural vision for your project, we can customise our broad range of glass products and systems to meet its specific safety, comfort, design, and energy-efficiency requirements

Learn more
Compliance

All of our systems are tested and certified by third-party certification bodies and come with test reports that demonstrate compliance with virtually any national certification scheme

Learn more
Sustainability

Improve occupants' health and well-being – and property values – while targeting higher levels of building certification. Our roducts come with evidence to support your work toward a sustainable future

Applications

Solving your glazing challenges is our expertise. Our broad range of fire-rated and bullet-, blast-, and impact-resistant glass products can be combined into multifunctional solutions for most specialty glazing applications. Every day we run tests with our steel, aluminium and timber framing partners to offer the broadest selection of systems.

Precision Electronic Glass | Custom Glass and Quartz Components

Precision Electronic Glass in New Jersey manufactures custom glass and quartz components, prototypes, and production runs for all industries.

Custom Laser Glass and Quartz Components
Custom Laser Glass and Quartz Components Are Among Our Specialties

Custom laser glass and quartz parts for CO2, YAG, and HeNe laser components are an important part of our business for years. Precision Electronic Glass (PEG) is a primary OEM supplier of laser flow tubes, discharge tubes, electrode tubes, glass-to-metal seals, gas port tubing, and gas-sealed tubes.

Custom Laser Glass Components for Applications Spanning Many Industries

PEG specializes in shrinking glass and quartz tubing into precision bore tubing. Also, our special capabilities include glass fabrication, glass finishing, glass machining, and glassblowing. Our expertise produces a wide range of glass components for various systems requiring custom laser glass and other technologies across industries.

Other standard and custom components that we produce include glass-to-metal seals, glass-to-glass seals, graded seals, and glass assemblies[...]

CONTACT US

Dependable Glass Works is proud to be a leader in the glass industry. For 50 years we have serviced local and national clients from our downtown Covington, LA location. Architects, contractors and home owners have called on our experience, innovation and cutting-edge technology to create beautiful designs in glass. Look through our project gallery to see the variety of projects.

From the fabrication of beveled edged mirrors and glass to counter tops and table tops, to glass stair treads and flooring; from hurricane resistant and bullet resistant glass to architectural decorative art glass, windows and walls we can service your needs. We have our own tempering plant that tempers glass as small as 6″ x 6″ up to 60″ x 120″ , with thicknesses of 1/8″  up to ¾”.

Our innovative staff can help you create a design that is custom made to meet your requirements, or we can help by refurbishing the existing glass and mirrors for your business or home. Tour our site to learn more about Dependable Glass Works or call our sales representatives to let us help you with all your glass needs.

WELCOME TO CINCINNATI GASKET & INDUSTRIAL GLASS

Cincinnati Gasket & Industrial Glass occupies over 65,000 square feet with state-of-the-art machinery and the finest quality inspection. Dependable, quick service, and competitive prices have made us one of the oldest and largest in the field with some of the newest and most innovative ideas in the industry.

We specialize in a wide range of machined glass products for use in nearly every major industry in the world; from the steel and chemical industries to machine tool and power generation. Whether replacing existing equipment or developing a new design, we can provide creative solutions to your industrial glass needs that will help increase efficiency and save countless hours of downtime in years to come.

 
SOME OF OUR SERVICES

Cincinnati Gasket and Industrial Glass offers fabrication for gaskets and for a full range of glass sizes. Fabrication processes we specialize in include surface and O.D. grinding, drilling, sawing, surface polishing, CNC machining, waterjet cutting, coatings, and sandblasting. Specialty fabricated glass features include UV blocking and infrared reflecting heat shield.

Family Owned and Operated, Since 1941

Koller Enterprises, Inc.
Who We Are

Founded in 1941, Koller Enterprises is a third-generation owned and operated business headquartered in Fenton, MO. With manufacturing operations in Missouri, Kansas, Alabama, and Michigan we provide world-class service and products to the Automotive, Industrial, Consumer Products, Commercial Lighting, Concessions and Food packaging markets.




Utilizing the 80/20 business process to identify and focus on the areas of critical importance, we continually research and invest in new technologies such as 3D printing, In Mold Labeling, and LED lighting production.

What We're Known For

Koller Enterprises is built upon a culture that values people and relationships. It is the people and the quality of their character that define any organization and its success. Koller seeks to strengthen and develop our people and our relationships with our suppliers to better enable us to serve our customers with consistent, reliable, quality products and services. In addition, working with one of our companies you can expect:




Service with a personal touch
Consistently high quality
Reliable on-time delivery
A focus on 80/20 principles
Deep commitment to safety
Where to Find Us
Our Mission is to deliver high quality, innovative, sustainable solutions to our customers grounded in safety and efficiency.
Sustainability

Being dedicated to people also means valuing sustainability. Royal Carolina Corporation is a full-service Rotary Screen and Flexographic Printing, Coating and Finishing Company located in Greensboro, North Carolina. Royal Carolina is dedicated to providing customers with on-time delivery and excellence in Service and Technology. Royal Carolina has an extensive network of distribution, manufacturing, and converting partnerships to assist you in a wide variety of areas. Our range of services is far reaching and constantly expanding to fit your needs. In addition to our printing, finishing and coating capabilities, we can provide 100% inspection, trimming, slitting, testing and packaging to meet your requirements.

We are more than the services we provide, we are a team of experienced professionals who offer assistance to a wide range of customers. If you are new to the industry or just want a printer you can rely on, Royal Carolina Corporation can help. We are here to educate and offer unparalleled support.

Our efforts focus on delivering total customer satisfaction and competitive price leadership. Our goal is to continue to build strong industry relationships and increase profits for our customers through technology and innovation. Strong emphasis is placed on excellent customer service from the time your order is placed until it is delivered. We are there when you need us most!

We would love to learn about your project!
Who is your product for? What kind of fabric do you envision? Does it need to have a fireproof coating? Our team works with you through the product development process to achieve your business goals.

Welcome to Specialty Glass

Founded in 1977, Specialty Glass (SG) has excelled at utilizing innovative production techniques to become a leading manufacturer specializing in glass melting and processing for a wide array of industries within global markets. Examples include glass solutions for the following: abrasives, computer heads, vitrified-bonded grinding wheels, dental glass fillers, electronics, sealing, wood preservation plus many other technical glass applications. We are a certified ISO 9001:2015 manufacturer.

OUR PRODUCTION TECHNIQUES
Furnace Melting

Crucible and day tank furnaces for melting are used to produce glass compositions tailored to our customer's specific requirements. With a new crucible or dedicated day tank, cross contamination is effectively eliminated, further ensuring customer satisfaction.

Frit / Cullet

Our melting facilities provide high quality, contamination-free products. Frits, either water quenched or roll quenched, are manufactured to standard or customer specified compositional requirements, with specific physical properties.

Powder

Utilization of crushing, dry and wet milling equipment allow SG to deliver coarse to fine micron-size powders.

Rods

Specialty Glass utilizes standard or customer specified glass compositions to be drawn or cast into rods of various sizes and shapes.

Forming

SG can form glass using a unique process of molten glass injection molding, direct pours into custom molds, and various other forming techniques.

SUPERIOR FIBERGLASS REINFORCED PLASTIC GRATING & STRUCTURALS

American Grating™ is a global manufacturer of Fiberglass Reinforced Plastic products, which include Grating, Structural Beams, Angles, Rebar and more. Our exclusive GRIDWALK™ systems offer the highest quality product available on the market today. FRP is used in a variety of Residential, Commercial, and Industrial settings from Oil and Offshore, Chemical Processing Facilities, Food Processing Plants to Pedestrian Bridges, Decks & Walkways. Our engineers are ready to assist you with your project needs. From supplying panels to turn-key projects, we are the FRP experts!

 

MOLDED FIBERGLASS GRATING

American Grating's GRIDWALK™ Molded FRP Grating is constructed in one-piece, using reinforced polyester or vinyl ester resin and continuous interwoven fiberglass strand. This gives it multi-directional strength and allows for fabrication such as holes, cut-outs, without losing any structural integrity. It's used for flooring systems, walkways, trenches, platforms, stairs and much more. Customers can choose from a variety of sizes, such as 4' x 12', 4' x 8', 3' x 10', 5’ x 10’ and thicknesses such as 1", 1-1/2", 2”. Molded grating is easy to fabricate. You can custom fabricate or we can fabricate panels to size for you.

 

PULTRUDED FIBERGLASS GRATING

American Grating's GRIDWALK™ Pultruded FRP Grating is ideal for longer spans and slightly lower in cost than Molded Grating. Its high load bearing strength makes it uniquely popular for spanning long distances. GRIDWALK™ grating uses a two part locking cross rod and features powerful uni-directional strength. The individual bars are made of glass roving and glass mat which gives it its strength. A surfacing veil provides high corrosion resistance. Used for flooring systems, walkways, trenches and platforms, customers can choose from a variety of sizes such as 3', 4' or 5' wide by 8', 10', or 20' lengths. Standard thicknesses are 1", 1-1/2", and 2", I bar or T bar are available.

Product highlights
OSRAM OSLON® Black Flat S, KW HHL533.TK
SMT package for High Power Forward Lighting applications widely in-use in global automotive market since several years. The leadframe based black package concept provides outstanding contrast and excellent 2nd board reliability for standard Headlamp solutions. The OSLON Black Flat S meets both excellent brightness in combination with high luminance.
Details and Datasheet
OSRAM Power TOPLED®, LA E67F.01
PowerTOPLED, a powerful member of the TOPLED family. Thanks to their high luminous efficacy, the LEDs are ideal for rear light clusters and indicators on vehicles and for display panels for traffic control systems.
Details and Datasheet
OSRAM OSCONIQ® P 3737 (2W), GH PUSRA1.25
High-power LED with our ams OSRAM’s latest chip technology, delivering industry leading performance, superior robustness and long lifetime. With the introduction of a new color (Red 640 nm) the family offers five colors for ease of design and high flexibility for all your horticulture spectrum needs. The OSCONIQ® P 3737 family offers Hyper Red (660 nm), Red (640nm), Deep Blue (450 nm), Far Red (730 nm) and Horti White which can cater to both narrow spectrum and full spectrum solutions to meet all crop needs for both greenhouses and vertical farms.
Details and Datasheet
OSRAM OSIRE® E5515, KRTBAELPS2.32
The ams OSRAM OSIRE KRTB AELPS2.32 RGB sidelooker device is specifically designed for automotive interior applications. It offers individually addressable LED chips for a maximum of flexibility in terms of color point, driver selection and interconnection. Due to the low profile, the OSIRE KRTB AELPS2.32 is ideally suited for coupling into thin lightguides and enables ultra compact designs. The housing material´s temperature stability has been optimized for improved compatibility to suitable IMSE® (In-mold structural electronics) processing. All Measurement data of every single LED is made available at 20 and 50 mA via an imprinted data matrix code. This feature helps to reduce the optical measurement effort on customer side.
Details and Datasheet
OSRAM OSIRE® E3731i, KRTBI D2LM31.31
This device is especially designed for automotive interior applications requesting high dynamic RGB lighting scenarios. This device is an intelligent RGB device, incorporating besides R/G/B LEDs an IC from ams OSRAM. This embedded IC integrates the drivers for the three R/G/B LEDs. The embedded IC includes the optical measurement data of the three R/G/B LEDs as well. An external micro controller can address and control each device in a daisy chain architecture via an open system protocol. The open protocol allows the micro controller to read back these data and to run any color algorithm. It also allows to read back a temperature value to optimize this color algorithm. OSIRE TM E3731i is compliant with all known patents and rights in countries with an automotive production footprint. In particular, neither rights in terms of temperature compensation within the LED nor SPI communication with controllers inside an LED are affected.
Details and Datasheet
OSRAM EVIYOS® HD 25 gen1, KEW GBCLD1U
ams OSRAM offers with EVIYOSTM HD25 gen1 a benchmark for intelligent HD headlamp solutions with 19.200 individual controllable pixels (aspect ratio 1:3). EVIYOSTM HD25 gen1 is the first lighting device which can realize two different use cases: 1. High resolution ADB and 2. Safety relevant signal projection on the road. Please note, that this product is only available as product set. The EVIYOSTM LED will be delivered together with a Companion ASIC.
Details and Datasheet
ams TCS3530 True Color Sensor with Flicker Detection
TCS3530 is an ultra-sensitive color sensor that matches the response of the human eye to visible light. The sensor’s highly accurate measurements of chromaticity and illuminance support superior automatic white balancing in cameras, as well as sophisticated display color management. Fully integrated optical assembly with built-in diffuser backed by end-of-line calibration simplifies manufacturers’ production processes and optical designs.
Details and Datasheet
OSRAM EVIYOS® HD 25 gen1, KEW GBBMD1U
ams OSRAM offers with EVIYOS HD25 gen1 a benchmark for intelligent HD headlamp solutions with 25.600 individual controllable pixels (aspect ratio of 1:4). EVIYOS HD25 gen1 is the first lighting device which can realize two different use cases: 1. High resolution ADB and 2. Safety relevant signal projection on the road. Please note, that this product is only available as product set. The EVIYOS LED will be delivered together with a Companion ASIC.
Details and Datasheet

Having manufactured fiberglass products since 1958, Atkore's FRE Composites is focused exclusively on the design, engineering, and production of composite filament-wound fiberglass conduit products and accessories that serve the electrical, utility, telecom, wastewater, data center, utility, transportation, commercial, and industrial markets.

Critical for Infrastructure:

Epoxy solution provides superior impact and crush resistance with the highest strength to weight ratio of any conduit. Suitable for above and below ground applications.
Epoxy Elbows are a light weight, no burn-through solution for sweeps of all sizes providing easier handling and better corrosion resistance than rigid metallic offerings.
Hazguard® XW Conduit is the ideal solution for Class 1 Div. 2 locations — For DOTs, airports, telecommunication provides, or anywhere subject to physical damage.

We offer FREE in-home estimates with our frameless shower doors! During your estimate we will take measurements of your shower enclosure and answer any and all of your questions. Once we measure and evaluate the area we'll be able to give you our best recommendations on a design that will bring to life an elegant shower enclosure that is beautiful, functional, within budget and most importantly is safe. Because of the years of experience we have and the number of shower enclosures we've installed, we fully understand what customers are looking for in their shower door contractor. Superior Frameless Showers specializes in custom showers enclosures built to fit any size bathroom.

OUR PROMISE 

 




To ensure you receive nothing but the best, we use only high-quality materials for your Frameless Shower Doors. We are so confident in the materials we utilize that all of the hardware we install comes with a limited LIFETIME replacement warranty. The occurrences of our handles rusting, the finishes tarnishing or hinges falling apart is slim to none! If in the rare occurrence this were to happen to your Frameless Shower Door and you are the original purchaser of the installation, at no cost to you we would exchange the effected hardware. 

 


OUR PROCESS

 


It all starts with a FREE in-home estimate. We will evaluate the area you would like your new Frameless Shower to be installed and then start the design phase. Our design professionals will work with you to create the perfect dream design and layout. With their expertise and innovative creativity they are able to maximize the functionality of your entire bathroom and present a stunningly beautiful design for your glass shower enclosure. Our team is able to present designs and   dramatic accents that others may never consider.

 


 


Our next step is taking measurements of your bathroom and designing and cutting each piece of glass individually. While bathrooms are typically similar to each other, we understand there are subtle differences so we customize each piece to ensure it fits perfectly. Our expert technicians fabricate all pieces in-house, so holes are drilled and notches are cut out right in our facilities. 

 


Once the glass pieces have been fabricated they are ready to be tempered for safety and strength (this process is required by code for all shower enclosures). Tempered glass (commonly referred to as safety glass) is considerably stronger than un-tempered or annealed glass and in the rare case it breaks, will shatter into small safer pieces. To temper the glass we put it through a process where we heat it to over 600 °C and then rapidly cool it with high-pressure air. Once the tempering process has begun the glass can no longer be modified in any way.  Upon request we can add a logo to a glass piece indicating it has a certification of tempering (this may be helpful for code officials). 

 


Installation is our last step; it is clean, simple and relatively quick. Depending on the type of enclosure, it could take at most 2-3 hours. All of our technicians at Superior Showers™ are certified to install our glass and hardware; they are also happy to answer any questions and educate you on your new Frameless Glass Shower. Once the installation is complete you will have a gorgeous new bathroom. 

 


SERENITY SERIES 

 




Make your bathroom feel even larger with a Serenity Frameless Shower!   

 


A minimal amount of hardware is needed, enhancing the open look of your Frameless Shower. The Serenity Frameless Shower is also versatile, it can be utilized in an in-line as well as a 90 degree shower enclosure.

ISO APPROVED ECLIPSE GLASSES

3D Glasses Online is proud to offer paper eclipse glasses with an optical density of 5 or greater that are both ISO approved and CE certified. Our solar eclipse glasses are completely safe and made with a scratch resistant black/silver polymer that filters out 100% of harmful ultraviolet rays, 100% of infrared rays, and 99.99% of intense visible light.

A common myth regarding solar eclipses is that a pair of sunglasses is sufficient to protect you from the harmful rays to which your eyes will be exposed. Sunglasses alone are not sufficient eye protection in this situation. If you look directly at an eclipse, it can burn your retina in a matter of seconds, resulting in permanent damage. The solution is to wear special eclipse glasses that are backed by a reputable organization, such as the American Astronomical Society (AAS). All paper eclipse glasses sold by 3D Glasses Online carry this certification.

Let American Paper Optics be your 3D solution provider for all things 3D related! Contact us today.

Experts In Custom Manufacturing And Distribution Of Quartz Products
We take pride in supplying fused quartz machining, slicing/cutting, fabrication/finishing, and distribution services for the research, scientific, photonic, solar, fiber optic and semiconductor industries for over 50 years.
LEARN MORE
CNC Milling
GM Quartz’s vast experience with CNC Milling has made this our hallmark process, core competency and an area of great pride. We have invested heavily in the most advanced, state-of-the-art equipment, tooling and fixturing to accommodate all of your most intricate design requirements. Our experienced engineers, programmers and technicians utilize the latest specialized applications and measurement systems to ensure that your parts are held to exact standards and produced in a timely and economical fashion.
• Thickness from .020” to .375”
• Diameters up to 24”
• Length up to 24”
• Holes greater than .010”
LEARN MORE
Angles, Slots, and Contours
Our expert programmers and machinists are the vanguard of providing intricate and complex geometries to meet the strict requirements of our highly technical customers. By employing state-of-the art lasers, waterjets, mills, drills, lathes, lappers and chemo-mechanical polishers (CMP) we are able to meet very difficult critical dimensions (CDs) on our angles, slots and contours. Our planarization and polishing capability provide highly uniform thicknesses with best-in-class total thickness variation (TTV) and optical quality clarity.
LEARN MORE
Lathe Turning
When you require a custom, highly accurate dimension for your inside and outside diameters on a flange or tube, our highly-skilled machinists know exactly what to do. By utilizing both computer numerical controlled (CNC) and manual lathes our technicians have the experience to produce high quality output for both large and small diameters.
• Thickness from .020” to .375”
• Diameters up to 32”
• Lengths up to 24”
LEARN MORE
Complex Fabrication
By expertly fusing art with science, our ISO9001 certified facility is equipped and staffed to design and fabricate complex system components for leading edge technology sectors including semiconductor, optical, scientific, biotech and other next generation applications. We offer custom work in solids machining, optical polishing, forming, welding and glassblowing. Whether you supply your own custom drawings or work with our engineers to design your component package we are committed to partner with you to deliver products that meet your exact requirements.

Latest News

Introducing EGL 6500 Snowhite II

We are excited to announce the release of our new color 6500 Snowhite II.

This will be our standard white and is now in stock in 8mm, 10mm, 12mm, and 15mm diameters.

8mm 6500 Snowhite II – Part Number 318008LF
10mm 6500 Snowhite II – Part Number 318010LF
12mm 6500 Snowhite II – Part Number 318012LF
15mm 6500 Snowhite II – Part Number 318015LF

Due to a discontinued phosphor, 6500 Snowhite II is not an exact match to our old 6500 Snowhite; therefore, we had to change the name slightly.

6500 Snowhite II is designed to offer customers a reliable and consistent white tubing option at a more cost-effective price point than our Tri-phosphor white.

We thank you for your continued support and patience as we strive to maintain the quality and reliability you have come to expect from our products.

« Older Entries
E10 Green – EGL Glass Product Notice

We need to share a crucial update concerning our E10 Green tubing.

Unfortunately, the green phosphor used to make E-10 Green has been discontinued by our supplier. We tried different options, but unfortunately, we couldn’t develop a new blend that matched our previous formula.

However, we are pleased to announce the development of a new green variant – “EGL Green II”.


While this new shade may differ slightly from its predecessor, we’re confident it will continue to provide neon benders with a high-quality green color.

EGL Green II is available in 8mm, 10mm, 12mm and 15mm diameters.

We understand that changes such as this may cause some inconvenience, and we appreciate your understanding during this transition.

Thank you for your continued support and patience as we strive to maintain the quality and reliability you have come to expect from our products.

If you have any trouble obtaining our glass from your local distributor please reach out to us directly so we can supply you with the glass you need.

A better way to view the World

Choosing the doors and windows for your home is an important decision, not only in terms of aesthetics, but above all for functional reasons.
A good door or window, to serve us well, must implement a number of primary characteristics including insulation against the heat in summer and the cold in winter, good acoustic comfort and protection against break-ins.
Such an important choice cannot be left to chance: it must be handled by high quality products, like the ones we manufacture.

Product Lines
The right doors and windows are designed so as to offer your home luxury and design in a simple and elegant manner, but without overshadowing the functional aspect. The quality of the raw materials, innovation, performance and style are combined to create products of excellence.

Planning and Design

Testimonials
slide 1 of 2

Throughout my time in the automotive glass industry (18 years), I have learned that building relationships is the key to success. For me this is driven by 3 key factors: honesty, integrity, and ownership, even when the products are not performing as they should. Twelve months ago, Larry Lindland (President & CEO) and I sat down with his new salesman Paul Black (Regional Sales Manager) for introductions and to discuss a previous failed coolant trial.

Larry opened the conversation up by owning his teams’ failures and asked what his team needs to do better. Over the last year, Paul and the LaPel team has delivered on every key point of our meeting and has worked to deliver a specialized product that will help to optimize the running conditions at my facility. From after-hour and weekend support to face-to-face meetings for the validation of their products, to onsite prep and management of products, LaPel left no rocks unturned. The buy-in to the success of their customers with quantitative results, shows the passion each member of the team has for their products and customers.

-Adam, Senior Production Specialist, major Automotive Glass Manufacturer

High-Quality
Jersey Tempered Glass, Inc. has been providing fabricated tempered and insulated glass for residential, millwork, industrial and OEM use nationwide since 1976. Through the use of advanced technology, Jersey Tempered Glass is dedicated to fulfilling the needs of today's challenging and ever changing glass market.
Fast Turnaround Time
JTG is your solution to create unique or custom product as fast as possible. Our clients trust us with their tight deadline jobs.
Attention to Details
"Quality in Glass" is more than a phrase with Jersey Tempered Glass. It's our way of doing business! When producing our products, "attention to detail" is prevalent throughout our company. A Great Variety of Products and Services

FAQ
How do the edges of the glass come?
All tempered glass comes with seamed edges , unless otherwise stated. Annealed glass does not have any edge work done to it, unless requested.
Do you ship?
Yes, we can ship UPS for an added cost. The largest we can ship UPS is 24" x 36".

We also can ship via freight carriers. This is at an additional cost that is calculated when an order is completed and crated. Then the cost will be added to the order.
Can you purchase glass from us if you are not a company?
Yes, we sell to individuals and companies alike.
What are your lead times?
Our lead times vary depending on the job. It depends on demand, supplies and job size. Our lead times are our expected completion of job and do not incuded shipping time.
How can I get pricing for my job?
You can send us a request for a quote one of two ways. You can fax us a quote request at 856-273-1999 or via email at quotes@jerseytemperedglass.com.
What are the smallest and largest size of glass you can temper?
Largest is 59" wide by 120" long.
Smallest 5" x 5".
However, trhe smallest size we can polish is 4.5"x4.5"

What thickness of glass do you temper?
We can temper any glass 1/8" or thicker up to 1/2". We carry 1/8, 5/32, 3/16, 1/4, 3/8 & 1/2 inches.
Can I have my own glass tempered?
Yes, we temper customer's specialty glass as well, as long as it is at least 1/8" or thicker up to 1/2" and is no larger than 59"x120".
What are you pick up times for customer's?
Our pick up department is available Monday to Thursday 7:00 am to 2:30 pm and on Friday 7:00 am to 1:30 pm.
Do you install or feld measure?
We currently do not install or feild measure a job.
Buy Tempered Glass from JTG for Top Quality and Service

Tempered glass is an important product that shouldn’t be purchased from just any manufacturer. So whether you’d like to fix a glass dining table or need all new windows on a corporate office building, Jersey Tempered Glass can provide you with top-notch products and services that are a major cut above the biggest commercial manufacturers.

Tempered Glass Online Store Makes Shopping Easy

As a homeowner or business owner having a go-to glass company for all your needs is essential. And you can bet that we offer better products and services than the largest glass manufacturers. You don’t have time to filter through every glass company in New Jersey. Just go to the Jersey Tempered Glass product page to view our products online and request a quote. We’ll determine the cost of your project, and you’ll be on track to replace or repair your glass in minutes at an affordable price.

Tempered Glass For Sale From JTG For Any Glass Project

No matter what glass project you need help with, JTG has the solution. We’ve done everything from shower doors to antique furniture, to shelves, windows, doors, tables, you name it! Having been in business for over 40 years, there’s no glass issue–commercial, residential, or industrial–that we haven’t seen and got from our manufacturers. 

Once you request a quote, we’ll have a specialist contact you to help you decide what the right type of glass is for your project. We offer a large variety of glass types and thicknesses, so you can pick the type of tempered glass that’s best for you. In addition, our tempered glass is four times stronger than normal annealed glass, so you can be sure that our tempered glass is incredibly strong and sturdy.

In our tempered glass store, you can choose your own size, shape, and edge finish so that each glass piece is totally unique to you and your project. Along the way, you can be assured that we will offer efficient and professional customer service. As a local company, we value a trusting relationship with our customers and will offer you much better service than our global competitors.

Tempered Glass Manufacturer for Multipurpose Needs

Jersey Tempered Glass is a tempered glass manufacturer that provides 1/8” tempered glass for any needs. The glass supplied by the tempered glass company is great for use in offices and at home. A characteristic feature of the glass is that it is better used in small insulated glass units. That is why it can be inserted into big glass windows or picture frames. In addition, you can use the glass from tempered glass manufacturers to design your cabinet door panels. It also looks great on glass shelves or end tables. It can also be compatible with any of your individual designs.

Where to Apply Glass from Tempered Glass Suppliers

There are also many other areas of use of glass from the tempered glass factory. Jersey Tempered Glass is one of the tempered glass suppliers that satisfy broad customer needs. It is important to remember that tempered glass is thin and fragile. This defines its popularity in areas where thin glass is needed. For example, it is used in architecture to design buildings’ windows. Tempered is also of low weight, and for this reason, it has an affordable price. That is why it can also be used in the solar and automotive industries. 1/8” glass type is most used in these areas.

Tempered Glass Store for Your Unique Glass Needs

Purchasing tempered glass from Jersey Tempered Glass is a no brainer! Just ask any of our previous customers, who consistently claim our tempered glass online store provides better quality service at a lower price than other New Jersey tempered glass companies.

No matter how complicated your project is, we have the tools to make it happen. Our variety of glass types and thicknesses, along with our customization options, means that we can make your glass dreams come true for any project, small or large. 

Contact us for more information or order a quote on your upcoming glass project.

*Testing demonstrates effective antibacterial activity against Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 6538), Enterobacter aerogenes (ATCC 13048), Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA-ATCC 33592), Escherichia coli O157:H7 (ATCC 35150) and Pseudomonas aeruginosa (ATCC 15442).

The use of EOSCU is a supplement to, and not a substitute for, standard infection control practices; users must continue to follow all current infection control practices, including those practices related to cleaning and disinfection of environmental surfaces. EOSCU has been shown to reduce microbial contamination but it does not necessarily prevent cross contamination. This product must not be waxed, painted, lacquered, varnished, or otherwise coated. This product must be installed by a certified EOSCU fabricator only.

OUR SERVICES

Cataracts are an inevitable part of life as we age, but the vision loss that comes with them doesn't have to be! At EyeHealth Northwest, we practice world-class cataract surgery at each of their many locations in the greater Portland area, including Oregon City, Milwaukie, Hillsboro and more. Time doesn't wait and neither should you - contact EyeHealth Northwest today!

CATARACTS

LASIK Eye Surgery at EyeHealth Northwest is your ticket to seeing Portland the way it's meant to be seen. Don't rely on glasses or contact lenses any more to get the best possible vision - the eye care experts at EyeHealth Northwest offer state-of-the-art LASIK surgery that delivers the surgical excellence you've come to expect.

LASIK

We offer the Portland area a wide array of aesthetic and reconstructive plastic surgery services. Cosmetic surgery isn't just about appearance - conditions such as droopy eyelids can affect your eyes' health and should be treated by professional eye doctors. We are proud to offer eyelid surgery, BOTOX treatments, cosmetic eyelid surgery and more.

COSMETIC

Since 2007, EyeHealth Northwest has been making hand-crafted lenses in our state-of-the-art optical lab located in Milwaukie, Oregon. Our certified opticians will guide you through selecting the best-looking and most functional frame for your prescription, face shape, and lifestyle. All EyeHealth Northwest opticians have an in-depth knowledge of optics, are nationally certified by the American Board of Opticianry, and receive ongoing training to provide you with world-class optical care.

Portland’s Trusted Eye Care Professionals Serving Our Community Since 1954

EyeHealth Northwest physicians and surgeons have been taking care of the communities of Portland for more than 70 years. Four hundred employees in eighteen locations, we are dedicated to providing expert care, pursuing our mission—preserving a lifetime of vision.

This dedication drives everything we do and every decision we make. We invest in the latest surgical and optical technology. We recruit the best trained and sought-after surgeons and staff. At the center of our vision is the customized patient experience. Our excellence in technology and surgical results is the foundation of our care. Our commitment to patient education, listening, and fully customized treatment plans are how to strive to accomplish our mission.

Built in the north, for the north.

Custom-manufactured 2-, 3- and 4-pane windows

Speed

With glass order shipping within two days and a team of local installers, Capitol Glass can help you upgrade your windows fast.

Made for Alaska

Windows made in the Lower 48 are designed for homes in the Lower 48. Northerm windows are designed for the high winds and subzero temperatures of Alaska’s northern climate.

Quality

Preferred by custom builders, engineered to perform the highest level of insulation, Northerm windows are fully customizable to serve as the architect’s showpiece of a great home.

Efficiency

Northerm windows provide a degree of insulating power (R-value) that compares with a structure’s walls. This “green” approach significantly reduces the energy necessary for home-heating.

Comfort

Feel confident placing your baby’s crib near a window. Northerm windows virtually eliminate the heat transfer (the “cold draft” feeling) caused by conventional, mass-produced windows.

Sixth City Glazing was built on the idea that our customers deserve a well-versed partner to work with from fabrication to installation on each and every project. We strive to be consistently exceptional in order to make each job an overwhelming success. By incorporating the principles of professional construction services to the glazing industry, our company delivers quality fenestration products with rewarding specialized services, providing our customers and clients consistent, reliable results from conception to installation.

What We Do
On paper, it’s simple... we provide a reliable, superior commercial glazing service. Whether we are assisting your team with budgeting, estimating, coordination or installation, we work hard and take serious pride in providing incomparable value. From any one of our fenestration products; storefront, aluminum windows, curtain wall or all-glass systems, we look forward to assisting you on your next project.

From Start to Finish
Budget/Estimate

From design and cost analysis to hard bid estimates, we will utilize our team of specialists to propose the best product for your project in order to stay within the budget, while also providing top-notch quality and value.

Shop Drawings/Fabrication

Sixth City will produce project-specific shop drawings, immersed with details that provide tremendous value for trade coordination. With these drawings, our specialized fabricators will take the lead in manufacturing the highest quality product in-house.

Safe/Timely Installation

By marrying the manufacture installation instructions, project specific details, shop drawings and standard practice, our crew pays special attention to the intricacies of each job in order to provide safe, exceptional service while meeting your deadlines and expectations.

Ultra Low-Loss Interconnects

Recognized for their exceptional ultra-low loss characteristics, our high-performance interconnects are meticulously engineered to ensure unparalleled reliability and optimum performance. Through the synergy of our patented two-component ferrule and proprietary Active Core Alignment process, which precisely aligns the fiber cores, we achieve insertion loss values that far exceed industry standards.

Read more

DIAMOND in Space

Diamond is the industry leader in Space qualified fiber optic interconnect solutions. We manufacture the only single-channel fiber optic interconnect qualified by the European Space Agency (ESA). We understand the technical requirements and performance standards required in the demanding conditions of Space. Our products have been successfully flown on many space missions, most recently the JUICE mission, and are part of the Perseverance Mars Rover and the James Webb Space Telescope.

Read more

High Power Interconnects up to 16W

The enhanced and upgraded series of Power Solution (PS) Interconnects withstands up to 16 watts optical power in Single-mode optical fiber maintaining exceptional Insertion Loss (IL) and Return Loss (RL) values. 

Learn more

1

Fiber Optic - reliable low loss fiber optic components

As a Swiss company with a long tradition in the development, manufacture, and assembly of high-precision fiber optic components, we operate in both national and international markets in the field of fiber optic technology. We are known for repeatable, very low insertion loss through the use of our patented Active Core Alignment. Diamond SA is also the inventor of the world famous E-2000® connector.

Connectors

 

Assemblies

 

Customized solutions

 

Technologies

DIAMOND - Fiber Optic quality at the highest level

As a vertically integrated company, Diamond SA is one of the few manufacturers that has full control over its entire manufacturing process. This is because high-quality ceramic, metal and plastic components, from raw materials to the finished end product, are all processed in-house. This system enables Diamond to guarantee that every single component meets all the quality, reliability and performance standards found in Diamond products around the world.

Read more

Fiber optic technology from a traditional Swiss company

From connectors to connector assemblies, customized solutions and technologies, we use our know-how to realize even the most challenging projects. This allows us to offer our customers a comprehensive range of quality products related to fiber optic connectors and fiber optic technology. In addition to a wide range of contemporary standard products, Diamond has the necessary dynamism to be able to quickly meet individual requirements with correspondingly customized problem solutions.

More about our Products & Technologies

 

 

Future-proof fiber optic technology for all applications

Our expertise in the field of fiber optic connections benefits our customers from a wide range of markets. As a result, the requirements that our fiber optic products have to fulfil are extremely diverse. In telecommunications, for example, we primarily ensure security and reliability and a future-proof reserve of data bandwidth. For use in industrial environments such as satellites, production machines or measuring instruments, it is particularly important that our products can withstand harsh conditions such as extreme temperatures, vacuum, vibrations, shocks, and the like. In medical technology, on the other hand, sensitive diagnostic equipment and surgical instruments require above all ease of handling, safety and sterilizability.

POWDER COATING

About AAG Glass

As a newly forged joint venture established in 2018 between AGC North America and AutoTemp Inc.. AAG Glass is uniquely positioned with both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and aftermarket expertise to manufacture the finest laminated glass products.

Learn More
Capabilities
Quality Control

AAG adheres to a stringent multi-stage, ongoing approach to quality control/quality improvement.

Engineering

AAG’s engineers utilize the latest in modern technologies to provide perfect fit and function in the most cost-efficient manner.

Tooling

AAG’s technicians use advanced machining equipment to fabricate and finish glass parts to critical tolerances.

Raw Glass

Our inventory includes an array of block glass more suitable for higher volumes. Appropriate sizing and part nesting techniques minimize costs due to waste reduction.

Cutting & Grinding

AAG’s engineering experience and sophisticated technologies allow us to produce complex shapes precisely and cost efficiently.

Silkscreen

AAG technicians can apply ink in any pattern before the laminating process to produce durable custom images.

Bending

AAG’s manufacturing facility is home to a Vetrotool furnace capable of producing flat, compound, cylindrical and complex bend applications.

Value Add

By operating 8 stations that occupy more than 20,000 sqft. of our manufacturing facility, AAG can perform an enormous array of Value-Add applications.

Warehousing Logistics

Our central location near Cincinnati, Ohio, provides AAG with tri-modal transportation options.

Markets
Automotive

Our reputation is behind the label for a majority of the world’s leading automotive glass providers.

Construction & Agriculture

The world’s leading manufacturers of construction and agricultural equipment turn to our company for the specialized, large and complex glass pieces that are not only remarkably durable, but protect users from the elements, enhance comfort and maximize visibility.

Recreational Vehicles

AAG delivers the products needed for utilitarian, sports, or luxury vehicle applications.

Worldwide Glass Resources®
LABORATORY AND INDUSTRIAL GLASS

Worldwide Glass Resources® is a premier solution provider offering engineering and technical expertise in the design and production of laboratory vials and accessories. WWGR Inc “Serving Scientists Worldwide” through its global network of distributors, OEM’s and diagnostic companies in such markets as Pharmaceutical R&D, Petrol-Chemical, Biotech, Environmental, Food & Fragrance, University and Government.
Our team’s expertise comes from years of experience in laboratory research, production, and customer service. This gives us a holistic advantage in delivering products and services that meet the needs of our customers.
Maintaining long term relationships with our customers enable us to stay at the forefront of innovation. We strive to become an extension of our customer’s operations, reaching out to meet their challenge as our own. We work together to find effective and profitable solutions that enable our customers to get back to what they do best, Science.
Worldwide Glass Resources® was founded in March 2001 as an assembly company in Southern New Jersey. Since 2003, WWGR has emerged as one of the leading laboratory vial manufacturers in the US.

A NEW ZERO-BUBBLE SEPTA (ZB SEAL™ CLOSURE) HAS BEEN ENGINEERED AND DESIGNED BY (ILT) SPECIFICALLY FOR EPA VIALS

Worldwide Glass Resources® has led in the area of Compound Purification/Library specialty vials for 2 decades offering standard and custom engineered products to work in automated liquid handling platforms and achieve low levels of extraction. We also offer unique custom barcode solutions in different materials, custom packaging, and tare & weigh if required.

OEM Quality for the North American Aftermarket

FYNA is your comprehensive source for OEM quality automotive glass supply and service to the North American market. We are pleased to be your source for products of our parent company, Fuyao Glass Industry Group Co., Ltd. (FYG), which has earned the following government certifications: DOT in America, ECE in Europe, SAA in Australia, and GB96565 in China. FYG has also earned international quality recognition by attaining certifications of ISO 9002, QS 9000, VDA6.1, ISO 14000 and TS 16949.

Quality Raw Materials

FYG carefully chooses high-quality, automotive-grade glass and PVB that meet OEM specifications.

OEM Quality

AS the major OEM glass supplier in China, FYG has worked with multiple leading vehicle manufacturers and has gained valuable expertise. FYG has the technology, including CAD design to produce windshields with complex bends while maintaining excellent optical quality.

Ease of Installation

It is easy to install FYG glass because of the good fit between the glass surface and vehicle body. Quality installation results in improved appearance, reduced wind noise levels and better occupant safety.

Solar Glass

Fuyao uses solar glass whenever it is required by OEM specifications. Solar glass reduces interior heat buildup and helps protect interior fabrics and materials from damaging UV rays.

About Verretec Composite Materials

Welcome to Verretec Composite Materials, the pioneer in thin, flat and light-weight fiberglass, and home of The Fabric of Innovation™. We produce glass fiber reinforcements for advanced composite applications. Recognized around the globe for our FlatFiber™ technology, Verretec sets the standard for thin, light, high strength glass reinforcements. Producing both glass fiber yarn and glass fabric, Verretec’s vertical integration strategy enables customized solutions for your unique composite challenges. We produce reinforcements in standard E-glass, E²-glass (process enhanced E-glass), and high performance glass compositions.

APPLICATION SPOTLIGHT
Video Surveillance

When it comes to video surveillance, capturing real-time, high definition video images is the easy part; getting that video to a command center can be challenging. Today’s high definition video cameras require ultra-high bandwidth, and streaming video – often from dozens of these cameras – can tax network backhaul performance. BridgeWave systems are purpose-built to deliver the capacity, performance, ease of installation and security that video surveillance applications demand.

LEARN MORE

BridgeWave is in the business of connecting people, places, and things – wirelessly. It’s been our mission since our founding in 1999, and it remains such today. Our legacy of providing point-to-point systems that deliver on their promises is the foundation of our reputation as leader in this market. We value the relationships we have formed throughout the world with customers who trust us with their networks and their businesses.

PRODUCTS AND SERVICES
IRON DOORS

We provide custom Iron doors fitted specifically for your existing or new construction openings. Out Iron Doors come with your choice of glass, locks and custom finish.

HARDWARE

We carry a full line of EMTEK and DELANEY locks and hinges. Whether you need a tubular or mortised lock configuration from solid brass to wrought steel and bronze, we can provide and install it in your new custom decorative entryway.

For more information on our hardware, feel free to contact us. We look forward to hearing from you!

FARMHOUSE DOORS

We offer a full line of single and double farmhouse doors. Custom or stock doors built specifically for your opening.

FULL SERVICE INSTALLATION

We offer specialized entryway remodeling services in our metro Atlanta all of Georgia and the Southeast service area.

For both new construction and retrofit applications, we have the skill and experience to perform a full service, turnkey installation. Our certification process assures you that fully-insured, highly skilled craftsmen will perform the work. We stand behind our workmanship 100%.

If you are outside of our service area, our sales design professionals will coordinate our work with your remodeler or builder of choice to assure all parameters and specifications are detailed and understood to assure a proper fit.

JD’S GLASSWORKS!
A WHOLE NEW WAY OF VIEWING THE WORLD!

Full-service supplier and installer of custom decorative Iron Doors, Wood doors, and windows for all applications. We offer complete turnkey entry door systems as well interior door services and the professional services to complete the job.

Our artisans can craft stained glass and beveled leaded art glass to your design specifications. Through precise coordination of our custom door, wrought iron, finish, glass and millwork shops, we are able to provide a fully integrated product with reasonable delivery times to the builder, remodeler, or homeowner.

Contact us today to learn how easy and affordable it is to add beauty and value with decorative glass and wrought iron doors and windows.

OUR MISSION

The mission and purpose for JD’s Glassworks is threefold:
1. To serve and glorify God by providing a business work environment founded on Biblical Christian principles.
2. To serve our customers with the highest quality products and services as well as integrity of business practice.
3. To serve our Associates by providing a stable work environment whereby they can grow and prosper spiritually, intellectually, and materially.

A NOTE FROM OUR PRESIDENT

Since 1985, JD’s has been the vendor of choice for custom decorative doors and windows. We specialize in the custom crafting of decorative glass and iron products that grace homes, churches and commercial establishments around the world.

 

As you browse our website, keep in mind that virtually all of the designs shown here can be customized to suit your unique taste and preference. Our Architectural Millwork facility can custom craft your door or complete entryway to your exact specifications. Our art glass and ornamental iron studios are a blend of old-world craftsmanship and state-of-the-art technology, and our artists are capable of providing you with computerized drawings of your unique design helping you to visualize your final product early in the specification phase.

On behalf of all the associates of JD’s Glassworks, I thank you for the opportunity to be of service to you and to enhance your home, place of business, or house of worship.

Jerry Douthit, President

ABOUT US


JD’s Glassworks, Inc. was founded by Jerry Douthit in 1985 and has firmly established its reputation for integrity in product design and customer service.

With an internationally installed base of products, JD’s has grown to be a major player in the custom decorative door and window industry. Catering to the Residential Homeowner, Architect or Builder, JD’s Glassworks is committed to providing each and every one of their clients with a delightful purchasing experience.

JD’s Glassworks’ extensive line of product designs includes custom decorative wrought iron door and window treatments, all locally designed and crafted. The combination of ornamental iron, exotic hardwoods, and beautifully textured art glass truly creates an entryway of distinction. This marriage of decorative design elements and textures is also available in complete wrought iron entry systems incorporating durable iron doors, frames and ornamental iron trim.

Key alliance partnerships have been established with local and international suppliers and artisans. This translates into greater value for JD’s clients through increased control of the delivery, quality, fit and finish of hardwoods, decorative glass, custom bevels and ornamental iron.

To facilitate a national sales presence, JD’s Glassworks forms Alliance Partnerships with key Remodelers and Builders in select regions to coordinate precise measurement and installation services.

JD’s Glassworks is a continual innovator in the industry and has led the way in combining modern techniques and methods with the stained and bevel leaded glass art form. For example, JD’s was one of the first to offer custom art glass as a true insulated, hermetically sealed unit. This protects the client’s investment in the art glass while providing the added benefit of energy efficiency and code compliance in many regions.

JD’s Glassworks is committed to keeping pace and leading the way in providing technically and architecturally sound decorative door and window products that beautify and add value and curb appeal to homes, churches, as well as commercial establishments.

For more information, contact any of JD’s Design and Sales Associates. Our contact information is provided below.

PRECISION LASER PROCESSING

From laser micromachining and optical fiber processing, to material handling, integrated inspection, self-calibration and machine automation, we are dedicated to solving our customer’s most difficult precision engineering challenges in biomedical, aerospace, semi-conductor and industrial technology manufacturing.

WE ARE OPTEK.

HUMANETICS SENSORS: OpTek is part of the Humanetics Sensors group that combines the capabilities of Fibercore's specialized fiber optics, HITEC's custom sensors and OpTek's fiber processing, micromanufacturing and precision engineering. Our combined capabilities offer customers a unique ability to develop custom fiber sensors for critical environments, at micron precision.

Solutions for Precision Engineering
Laser Micromachining

From micro holes with diameters down to a few microns and sub-micron tolerances to laser scribes a few 10s microns wide, laser processing and micromachining provides a highly versatile manufacturing solution.

Learn More
Optical Fiber

The unique optical fiber processing capabilities offered by OpTek allows the production of cleaved and lensed assemblies with unmatched functionality.

Learn More
Range of Applications

OpTek offers unique advantages for material processing in an ever increasing range of laser micromachining and optical fiber applications. Discover our highly diverse range of capabilities.

Learn More
Customer Support

From contract manufacturing and tailored equipment, to support and unrivaled expertise, OpTek supports your unique requirements across three continents, in production-critical environments.

Learn More
Humanetics Biomed

Discover the combined capabilities of Humanetics, including OpTek, through Humanetics Biomed. With over 50 years of expertise in custom sensors, specialized fibers and laser engineering we are your ideal Biomedical CDMO partner.

Humanetics unites its group to focus on digital, safety and sensor technologies

Humanetics Sensors

Humanetics Sensors combines the capabilities of Fibercore's specialized fiber optics, HITEC's customer sensor design and assembly and OpTek's fiber processing, micromanufacturing and precision automated engineering to address advanced sensor needs across multiple sectors. Our combined capabilities offers customers a unique ability to develop custom advanced sensors for critical environments, at micron precision and scalable production speeds.

The global leader in specialty optical fiber solutions that enable precise sensing and control in the world’s most demanding and harsh environments.

UNDER NEW OWNERSHIP

We are committed to earning your trust, build stronger relationships, and delivering exceptional service.
Desert Glass Works
Crafting Excellence in Quartz Fabrication

Experience the distinction of custom, handcrafted quartz designed to meet your exact specifications. Harness the competitive edge with premium materials, expertly crafted by a team of seasoned professionals boasting over a century of combined experience and a deep passion for the science and art of precision.

Learn about solutions for your business
Our Products 
Quartzware Fabrication

The intricate process of transforming raw quartz into precise, high-performance components involves cutting, grinding, drilling, polishing, and assembling quartz glass while preserving its exceptional purity and thermal properties. Using advanced tools like diamond saws, CNC machines, and lasers, our skilled experts craft everything from complex designs to standard components with unmatched precision and durability. With DGW, you get expert craftsmanship tailored to your unique needs.

Custom Machining

DGW offers precision custom machining for quartzware, using advanced CNC equipment and diamond-impregnated tools to meet the demanding needs of the semiconductor industry. We specialize in creating intricate, non-standard components with features like complex geometries, tight tolerances, and precise holes or slots. Whether you need tailored designs or specialized features, our unique expertise ensures your quartzware is crafted to match your specific design for optimal performance in critical applications.

Quartzware Repair

When your quartz equipment breaks, DGW understands the urgency of getting back to production. We specialize in fast, reliable repairs for tanks, chambers, and other essential quartzware, often restoring them to OEM specifications at a fraction of the cost of replacement. With decades of expertise and a skilled team, we can quickly repair or restore your quartz fixtures to minimize downtime and save you thousands. Let us help keep your business running smoothly.

About our company

We specialize in bringing innovative ideas to life with precision-crafted custom solutions. Our team of 20 skilled machining and fabrication experts is dedicated to meeting unique needs and turning visions into reality. We pride ourselves on delivering high-quality products, fast turnaround times, and exceptional customer service to build trusting, lasting partnerships.

Frequently Asked Questions
The glass in the top portion of my window is broken. Do I have to replace the whole window?

Only the section of glass that is broken has to be replaced.

I have insulated windows and they are foggy. Can it be repaired?

Yes.  You do not have to replace the entire window.  Our experts are able to replace the insulated glass to match the glass we are replacing.

My window will not go up. Can it be repaired?

Yes.  Our experts can give you an estimate on the same day.  All we need is a picture of the window with details of the issue.

One window pane in my french door is cracked. Can it be repaired/replaced?

Yes, we can replace just that one broken pane of glass.  Click on "request a free estimate" and load an image of the broken pane.

Most Popular Event Tent Types
STILLWATER SAILCLOTH TENTS
VIEW DETAILS
Transform your event rentals with the award-winning Stillwater Sailcloth Tent. This elegant and spacious tent has been exceeding expectations since its debut and is the perfect choice when you need to elevate a space for weddings and upscale events.
 
POLE TENTS
VIEW DETAILS
Available in single or double styles, pole tents offer spacious coverage for weddings, reunions, graduations & more. Their durable and classic design makes them a trusted investment for event rental companies.
 
FRAME TENTS
VIEW DETAILS
Maximize your event space and minimize visual clutter with a frame tent. Their efficient design uses fewer poles, creating a spacious interior ideal for dance floors or unobstructed views. Perfect for events like weddings or galas where functionality and open layout are key.
 
CUSTOM TENTS & STRUCTURES

The sky is the limit at Fred's Tents! We work closely with our clients to custom manufacture whatever tent, part, piece, frame, or wall they may need. Let us help you bring your vision to life.

Need durable tent components? Fred's has you covered! From sidewalls and poles to doors and accessories, we provide quality accessories for commercial and industrial tents.
 
CUSTOM GRAPHICS & PRINTING
VIEW DETAILS
Bring your vision to life with award-winning printing! Voted "Best Custom Graphics Supplier" 4x by InTents Reader's Choice, we customize tents for any event or brand. From logos to intricate designs, we can print on anything. And we mean anything.

What We Do...

Excellence comes with experience and our team has developed state-of-the-art techniques to provide you with the best products available anywhere

Glass & Ceramic Screen-Printing

Kapan-Kent has been a current leader in custom screen printing of glass and ceramic for over 50 years. We take pride in our efforts to give each client the personal customization of their design to ensure a unique custom piece for your design.

LEARN MORE
Sublimation

We use the latest technology in a 4-color process sublimation to deliver a photo real, tightly registered, multicolor full-wrap imprinted design incorporated with half tones and vibrant colors.

LEARN MORE
Law Enforcement Drinkware

Wherever officers, employees, chiefs of police, officer associations or volunteers esteem their department, you will find our work. Exceptional registration, attention to detail, fair pricing, low minimums, prompt turnaround, and excellent customer service are the hallmarks we pride ourselves in.

LEARN MORE

Since every custom order begins with the artwork, we want to help you create a design that will give you a high quality product that your customers will love.
We have a large catalog of art you can choose from to customize for your location, or you can submit your own art work for us to use.

ABOUT US...

Established in 1958 by Arnold Kapan and celebrating over 50 years in business, Kapan-Kent is one of the leading custom silkscreen glassware and ceramic decorators in the United States.

Sales & Customer Service

The Kapan-Kent sales team is a highly trained and motivated staff that works together as a team to ensure that each and every client gets the personal attention that they deserve.

They are experts in understanding and educating you as to what are “top sellers”, “popular designs”, and what they believe will deliver the success of your product.

Art Team

We have a finely developed in house art department made up of highly skilled and educated graphic artists that bring your ideas and concepts to “Life”. They are creative in originating new designs and concepts to help you promote your product in the most appealing way.

Give them an idea and they can create it for you. Don’t know exactly what you want? Let our art and sales team come up with suggestions that will suit and exceed your specific needs.
If you can imagine it…WE WILL MAKE IT HAPPEN!

We Make the Ordinary, Extraordinary

 

North American Coating Laboratories provides thin-film coatings for a variety of customers in the polymer and glass optical markets. Our experience in both dip and vacuum-applied processes make NACL one of the most respected organizations in the optical coatings industry since our founding in 1974.

Our coating competencies include protective, scratch-resistant, reflective, anti-reflective, filter, conductive, ITO, chemically resistive, and infrared coatings. With more than 90 years of thin-film design experience on staff, we can help you with any application from the UV to the long-wave infrared. North American Coating Laboratories is certified to ISO 9001 with design standards, and ITAR Registered.

With over 30 years industry experience, Hospitality Brands was founded to innovate and redefine glassware in the hospitality sectors. What started as a designer of custom glassware, has grown into a leading provider, specializing in luxury glassware and drinkware for the hospitality industry.

Our approach blends timeless craftsmanship with modern design, producing unique, high-quality products. Whether handmade or machine-made, every piece reflects our dedication to quality and artistry, enhancing your guests experience with modern luxury.

Driven by innovation, we offer bespoke designs and flexible solutions that transform glassware and drinkware into functional art.

About ARTon Products

Since 1986, ARTon Products has proudly provided custom glassware to happy customers all across the nation. Whether you’re a small business owner, CEO for a well-established company, or simply want personalized glasses to celebrate a huge milestone in your life — our family-owned and operated facility will fulfill your order no matter the size! Thanks to our dedicated team, we’ve become the go-to supplier of branded glasses for a majority of the major wine and craft beer festivals in the United States.

With the best-in-class customer service combined with an unmatched commitment to excellence, ARTon Products is excited to create a lasting impression with you.

Welcome to Cristaux International, your premier destination for custom awards and recognition programs! CELEBRATE EXCELLENCE WITH CUSTOMIZED AWARDS

No matter what milestone you wish to honor, recognizing excellence is always a meaningful gesture. At Cristaux, we understand the significance of commemorating individuals and teams who inspire greatness. Explore our customizable awards and discover timeless pieces tailored to embody your appreciation.

FINANCIAL DEAL TOYS

After the handshakes and signatures, your team deserves a tombstone equal to everyone’s accomplishments.

BUILDING REPLICAS

Embody the heart and soul of what you built with a replica that accurately reflects your company.

COMPANY BRANDED

SELECT CREATIONS

Capture attention. Stand out. Define a new idea. You can have a custom creation that is as astonishing as you.

OUR PERSONALIZATION PROCESS

At Cristaux, we aim to make customization seamless and enjoyable. From our first conversation to the moment you receive the finished product, we focus on creating awards that align with your vision and celebrate your recipients.

INITIAL CONSULTATION

We explore the goal of your award, highlight the recipient’s accomplishments, and integrate your brand identity. This foundational step is essential to capturing your expectations in detail.

CREATIVE DESIGN PROCESS

We determine the most fitting materials, color schemes, production techniques, and design elements. Whether you bring a clear concept or an initial idea, we refine the design to reflect your vision perfectly.

PRODUCTION

After finalizing the design, we craft a prototype to ensure the concept translates effectively into reality. Once approved, we move swiftly into production, guaranteeing a smooth and efficient process from start to finish.

SHIPPING

Keeping quality control in-house, our simplified drop-shipping solution handles all logistical challenges, ensuring that your awards are delivered securely and on time.

Defenshield is a service disabled veteran-owned small business (SDVOSB) specializing in the engineering and development of bullet, blast, and fragment resistant equipment for the government, military, law enforcement and private sector for anti-terror, force protection, and physical security requirements. Our products are NIJ certified and rigorously tested to provide the protection you need.
